sentences.text: March 9, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Stockholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the Fluor Corporation 2017 annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meeting will be held on Thursday, May 4, 2017, beginning at 8:30 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Daylight Time, at the Fluor Corporation Headquarters at 6700 Las Colinas Boulevard, Irving, Texas 75039.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information about the meeting is presented on the following pages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the formal items of business to be brought before the meeting, members of management will report on the company's operations and respond to stockholder questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A map showing the meeting location is included for your convenience on the back page of this booklet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hope that you will be able to attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, whether or not you plan to attend the meeting, we encourage you to review our proxy materials and promptly cast your vote over the Internet or by phone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, if you request or receive a paper copy of the proxy materials by mail, you may vote by signing, dating and mailing the proxy card or voting instruction card in the envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting in one of these ways will ensure that your shares are represented at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thank you for your continued support of Fluor Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I look forward to seeing you on May 4t
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: David T. Seaton Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS To Be Held May 4, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual meeting of stockholders of Fluor Corporation will be held at the Fluor Corporation Headquarters at 6700 Las Colinas Boulevard, Irving, Texas 75039, on Thursday, May 4, 2017, at 8:30 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Daylight Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the meeting, our stockholders will consider and vote on the following matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. The election of the thirteen directors named in the proxy statement to serve until the 2018 annual meeting of stockholders and until their respective successors are elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. An advisory vote to approve the company's executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. An advisory vote on the frequency of stockholder advisory votes to approve the company's executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. The approval of the Fluor Corporation 2017 Performance Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. The ratification of the appointment by our Audit Committee of Ernst & Young LLP as independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. If properly presented at the annual meeting, a stockholder proposal requesting adoption of greenhouse gas emissions reduction goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders will also act on such other matters as may be properly presented at the meeting or any adjournment or postponement thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders of record at the close of business on March 7, 2017 are entitled to receive notice of, and to vote at, the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are cordially invited to attend the meeting in person; however, regardless of whether you plan to attend the meeting in person, please cast your vote as instructed in the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the "Notice"), by either voting your shares over the Internet or by phone, as promptly as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, if you wish to receive paper copies of your proxy materials, including the proxy card or voting instruction card, please follow the instructions in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once you receive paper copies of your proxy materials, please complete, sign, date and promptly return the proxy card or voting instruction card in the postage-prepaid return envelope provided, or follow the instructions set forth on the proxy card or voting instruction card to authorize the voting of your shares over the Internet or by phone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your prompt response is necessary to ensure that your shares are represented at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carlos M. Hernandez Executive Vice President, Chief Legal Officer and Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1  ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of Peter K. Barker, Alan M. Bennett, Rosemary T. Berkery, Peter J. Fluor, James T. Hackett, Samuel J. Locklear, Deborah D. McWhinney, Armando J. Olivera, Joseph W. Prueher, Matthew K. Rose, David T. Seaton, Nader H. Sultan and Lynn C. Swann has been nominated for election at the Annual Meeting to serve a one-year term expiring at the annual meeting in 2018 and until his or her respective successor is elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the nominees listed above has agreed to serve as a director of the company if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company knows of no reason why the nominees would not be available for election or, if elected, would not be able to serve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any of the nominees decline or are unable to serve as a nominee at the time of the Annual Meeting, the persons named as proxies may vote either (1) for a substitute nominee designated by the Board to fill the vacancy or (2) just for the remaining nominees, leaving a vacancy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, the Board may reduce the size of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the standard applicable to the company's director elections, a director must receive the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast; except that directors shall be elected by a plurality of the votes cast if as of the record date for such meeting, the number of director nominees exceeds the number of directors to be elected (a situation we do not anticipate).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the votes cast means that the number of shares voted "for" a director nominee must exceed the number of shares voted "against" that director nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an incumbent director is not re-elected, the Governance Committee will consider his or her contingent resignation given prior to the meeting and make a recommendation to the Board on whether to accept or reject the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will then publicly announce its decision regarding whether to accept the resignation and, if not, the reasons why.

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fluor has long believed that good corporate governance practices promote the principles of fairness, transparency, accountability and responsibility and will help manage the ompany for the long-term benefit of its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the past year, we continued to review our corporate governance policies and practices, compare them to those uggested by various commentators on corporate governance and the practices of other public companies and engage with our stockholders on corporate governance issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following list highlights some of our more recent corporate governance initiatives and core governance values:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We adopted proxy access bylaws giving stockholders the ability to nominate and include director nominees in the company's proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy access is available to a stockholder, or group of up to 20 stockholders, that have owned at least 3% of our outstanding shares of common stock for at least three years, and can be used to nominate up to two directors or 20% of the Board (whichever is greater), provided that the requirements of the bylaws are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Director Elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors stand for election on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Board Evaluations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We conduct annual evaluations of the Board, its committees and all Board members
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Right to Call a Special Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of at least 25% of our outstanding shares of common stock have the right to call a special meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Voting Provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate governance documents contain majority (as opposed to supermajority) voting provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors, with the exception of our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have a Lead Independent Director who presides over executive sessions of the independent directors of the Board and approves agendas and schedules for Board meetin
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our Board reviewed all committee charters and updated the company's Audit Committee and Governance Committee charters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board amende he company's Corporate Governance Guidelines and Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can access our current committee harters, Corporate Governance Guidelines, Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Members of the Board of Directors, as well as other information regarding our corporate overnance practices, on our website at www.fluor.com under "Sustainability"  "Governance"  "Corporate Governance Documents."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Fluor employees can be found on our website at www.fluor.com under "Sustainability"  "Ethics and Compliance"  "The Code."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fluor has a long tradition of engaging with its stockholders and being responsive to their perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to our regular investor days organized by Investor Relations, we meet with stockholders on corporate governance and other topics of interest to them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to adopting corporate governance initiatives, including those noted above, we consider the policies of our stockholders and solicit their perspectives on potential courses of action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In late 2015 and early 2016, Fluor engaged in outreach to investors on a number of topics, including proxy access and disclosure of political contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering the feedback we received on proxy access, our Board amended our Bylaws in February 2016 to adopt the proxy access provisions summarized above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of our Amended and Restated Bylaws is available on our website, www.fluor.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, in response to stockholder feedback on a proposal requesting disclosure of political contributions, the Board approved an amendment to our political activities policy that, among other things, requires that corporate political contributions be disclosed on a semi-annual basis in reports posted on the company's website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy, as well as the first semi-annual report, are available on our website, www.fluor.com, in the "Sustainability  Governance" section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the New York Stock Exchange listing standards and our Corporate Governance Guidelines, our Board determines annually which directors are independent and, through the Governance Committee, oversees the independence of directors throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to meeting the minimum standards of independence adopted by the New York Stock Exchange, a director qualifies as "independent" only if the Board affirmatively determines that the director has no material relationship with the company (either directly, or as a partner, stockholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with the company).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A relationship is "material" if, in the judgment of the Board, the relationship would interfere with the director's independent judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has adopted director independence standards for assessing the independence of our directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These criteria include restrictions on the nature and extent of any affiliations the directors and their immediate family members may have with us, our independent accountants, organizations with which we do business, other companies where our executive officers serve as compensation committee members and non-profit entities with which we have a relationship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our independence standards are included in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, which are available on our website at www.fluor.com under the "Sustainability"  "Governance" section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, as recommended by the Governance Committee, has determined that each of the company's current directors and director nominees (other than Mr. Seaton) are ndependent of the company and its management under New York Stock Exchange listing standards and the standards set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also determined that each of the members of the Audit, Governance and Organization and Compensation Committees has no material relationship with Fluor and is ndependent within the meaning of the New York Stock Exchange listing standards and Fluor's director independence standards for such committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making its independence determination with regard to Ms. Berkery, the Board considered
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) payments in 2014 (as there were no payments in 2015 or 2016) for less than $10,000 in the aggregate to Mayer Brown LLP, where one of Ms. Berkery's brothers is a partner, for services not provided by Ms. Berkery's brother and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) payments to PricewaterhouseCoopers ("PWC"), where another of Ms. Berkery's brothers is a partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With regard to PWC:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the fees paid to PWC in each of the last three years were less than .02% of such firm's revenues;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its oversight function, the Board monitors how management operates the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When granting authority to management, approving strategies and receiving management reports, the Board considers, among other things, the risks and vulnerabilities the company faces.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board discusses risks related to the company's business strategy at the Board's annual strategic planning meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also delegates responsibility for the oversight of certain risks to the Board's committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Audit Committee charter, the Audit Committee is responsible for reviewing and discussing with management the company's most significant risks, methods of risk assessment, risk mitigation strategies, and the overall effectiveness of the company's guidelines, policies and systems with respect to risk assessment and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Audit Committee considers risk issues associated with our overall financial reporting, disclosure process, legal matters, regulatory compliance and information technology, as well as accounting risk exposure and other operational and strategic risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is provided quarterly information on the geographic, operational and market risks facing our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out its responsibilities related to risk oversight, the Audit Committee meets in executive sessions, at least quarterly, with the Chief Executive Officer, the Chief Financial Officer, the Chief Legal Officer, the Chief Compliance Officer, the head of internal audit and the independent registered public accounting firm to discuss particular risks facing the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee is also tasked with certain elements of risk oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee annually reviews the company's compensation policies and programs, as well as the mix and design of short-term and long-term compensation, to confirm that our compensation programs do not encourage unnecessary and excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, the Governance Committee is responsible for overseeing governance issues that may create governance risks, such as board composition, director selection and the other governance policies and practices that are critical to the success of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Audit, Governance and Organization and Compensation Committees report quarterly to the Board regarding the areas they oversee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board has also established a Lead Independent Director position, as it believes that the role of Lead Independent Director promotes effective governance when the company has a non-independent Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed below, the Lead Independent Director is elected every three years, and his or her duties are closely aligned with the role of an independent chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that its current leadership structure provides independent Board leadership and engagement while also offering the benefits described above of having our Chief Executive Officer serve as Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each of the Audit, Governance and Organization and Compensation Committees is composed entirely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, independent directors directly oversee critical matters such as the compensation policy for executive officers, succession planning, our methods of risk assessment and risk mitigation strategies, our Corporate Governance Guidelines, policies and practices, the director nominations process, our corporate finance strategies and initiatives, and the integrity of our financial statements and internal controls over financial reporting.

sentences.text: Director Qualifications and Diversity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that the Board, as a whole, should include individuals with a diverse range of backgrounds and experience to give the Board both depth and breadth in the mix of skills represented for the benefit of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As provided in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, while all directors should possess business acumen and must exercise sound judgment in their oversight of our operations, the Board endeavors to include in its overall composition an array of targeted skills that complement one another rather than requiring each director to possess the same skills, perspective and interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board and Governance Committee consider the qualifications of directors and director nominees both individually and in the broader context of the Board's overall composition and the company's current and future needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines contain Board membership criteria that apply to current directors as well as nominees for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee is responsible for reviewing with the Board on an annual basis (and as needed) the appropriate skills and characteristics required of Board members in the context of the current make-up of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This annual review takes into consideration issues of diversity of thought and background (including gender, race, ethnicity and age), experience, qualifications, attributes and skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain criteria that our Board looks for in a candidate include, among other things, an individual's business experience and skills, judgment, independence, integrity, reputation and international background, the individual's understanding of such areas as finance, marketing, information technology, regulation and public policy, whether the individual has the ability to commit sufficient time and attention to the activities of the Board, the fit of the individual's skills and personality with those of other directors in building a Board that is effective, collegial and responsive to the needs of the company, and the absence of any potential conflicts with the company's interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board assesses its effectiveness in achieving these goals in the course of assessing director candidates, which is an ongoing process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review and Approval of Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has adopted a written policy for the approval of transactions to which the company is a party and the aggregate amount involved in the transaction will or may be expected to exceed $100,000 in any calendar year if any director, director nominee, executive officer, greater-than-5% beneficial owner or their respective immediate family members have or will have a direct or indirect material interest (other than solely as a result of being a director or a less than 10% beneficial owner of another entity).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides that the Governance Committee reviews certain transactions subject to the policy and determines whether or not to approve or ratify those transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In doing so, the committee takes into account, among other factors it deems appropriate, whether the transaction is on terms that are no less favorable to the company than terms generally available to an unaffiliated third party under the same or similar circumstances and the extent of the related person's interest in the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board has delegated authority to the Chair of the Governance Committee to pre-approve or ratify transactions where the aggregate amount involved is expected to be less than $1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of any new transactions pre-approved by the Chair is provided to the full Governance Committee for its review in connection with each regularly scheduled Governance Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee has considered and adopted standing pre-approvals under the policy for limited transactions with related persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: employment of immediate family members of directors, director nominees, executive officers and greater-than-5% beneficial owners in non-executive position with the company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: business transactions with other companies at which a related person's only relationship is as an employee (other than an executive officer) if the amount of business falls below the thresholds in the New York Stock Exchange's listing standards and the company's director independence standards; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: contributions to non-profit organizations at which a related person's only relationship is as an employee (other than an executive officer) or director if the aggregate amount involved does not exceed the lesser of $1 million or 2% of the organization's consolidated gross annual revenues.

sentences.text: At least annually, a summary of new transactions covered by the standing pre-approvals described above is provided to the Governance Committee for its review.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2  ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking stockholders to vote on an advisory resolution to approve the company's executive compensation as reported in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described below in the "Compensation Discussion and Analysis" section of this proxy statement, the Organization and Compensation Committee has structured our executive compensation program to achieve the following key objectives that contribute to the company's long-term success:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Objective      Achievement of the Objective     Align Named Executives with Stockholders      Annual and long-term incentive programs reward named executives for achievement of short- and long-term goals that enhance stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Between 58% and 73% of named executive target total direct compensation is equity-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named executives are expected to hold company shares or units with a value between two and six times their base salary and are prohibited from hedging or pledging company securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance       85% to 90% of the annual incentive for named executives is tied to company performance, including corporate measures such as net earnings, cash flow from operations and business segment performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentive payouts under our 2016 Value Driver Incentive Program are tied to earnings per share and return on assets employed, and also are directly related to the stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract and Retain Top Talent      Total compensation for named executives is targeted at the 50th percentile of the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge stockholders to read the "Compensation Discussion and Analysis" beginning on page 21, which describes in more detail how our executive compensation policies and procedures operate and are designed to achieve our compensation objectives, as well as the Summary Compensation Table and related compensation tables and narrative appearing on pages 41 through 56, which provide detailed information on the compensation of our named executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee and the Board of Directors believe that the policies and procedures articulated in the "Compensation Discussion and Analysis" are effective in achieving our goals and that the compensation of our named executives reported in this proxy statement has supported and contributed to the company's success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), and as a matter of good corporate governance, we are asking stockholders to approve the following advisory resolution at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders of Fluor Corporation (the "Company") approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Company's named executives as disclosed pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the Summary Compensation Table and the related compensation tables and narrative in the Proxy Statement for the Company's 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory resolution, commonly referred to as a "say on pay" resolution, is non-binding on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although non-binding, the Board and the Organization and Compensation Committee will
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review and consider the voting results when evaluating our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An advisory stockholder vote on the frequency of stockholder votes to approve executive compensation is required to be held at least once every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company last held an advisory vote on frequency in 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After consideration of the vote of stockholders at the 2011 annual meeting of stockholders and other factors, the Board decided to hold advisory votes to approve executive compensation annually until the next advisory vote on frequency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory vote on frequency is presented as Proposal 3 below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the Board modifies its policy on the frequency of future advisory votes to approve executive compensation after taking into consideration the stockholders' vote on Proposal 3 below, the next advisory vote to approve executive compensation will be held at the 2018 annual meeting of stockholders.

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis describes the principles, objectives and features of the compensation program, as well as the decisions made under this program in 2016, for our named executive officers (referred to herein as the "named executives").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, our named executives were our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, our Chief Financial Officer and the other three individuals included in the Summary Compensation Table on page 41.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to motivate excellent performance and to create alignment with company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the markets we serve faced many uncertainties and challenges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, lower commodity prices continued to impact many of our clients' cash flows and, therefore, their ability to fund projects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we faced execution challenges on one of our projects that negatively impacted our earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This disappointing performance is reflected in the payouts for the named executives' annual incentive awards, which averaged 71% of target, and will also negatively impact payments under our Value Driver Incentive ("VDI") plan when those goals are measured at the end of the three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These actual and potential payouts and our realizable pay analysis on page 23 demonstrate our pay for performance alignment and commitment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee (the "Committee") did not make any changes to base salaries or target bonus opportunities for 2016, leaving them consistent with 2015 levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee did make revisions to the 2016 VDI plan that are intended to keep named executives focused on goals that create stockholder value throughout a challenging business environment while also ensuring goals remain relevant on a year-to-year basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview of Fiscal 2016 Business Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite the challenges we faced in 2016, we built upon our backlog across a diverse set of clients and end markets, and we furthered our progress on our goal of providing more integrated solutions for our clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also remained focused on our cash flow generation and our core value of safety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Awards and Backlog.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New awards in 2016 were strong, totaling $21.0 billion across our business lines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We ended 2016 with a consolidated backlog of $45.0 billion, which is level with $44.7 billion in backlog at the end of 2015, despite the challenging market and lack of capital spending in the commodities industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Integrated Solutions and Capital Efficiency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our clients continue to seek greater capital efficiency as well as cost and schedule certainty.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we took deliberate steps to add to our capabilities in areas that enhance our ability to provide capital efficient solutions across the full life cycle of a project  specifically, fabrication, self-perform construction, supply chain, and operations and maintenance services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further this strategy, we completed our acquisition of Stork Holding B.V., allowing us to expand our operations and maintenance offerings, thereby strengthening our ability to provide complete life cycle services to our clients around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also significantly expanded our fabrication capabilities for onshore and offshore projects globally through our joint venture with China Offshore Oil Engineering Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ltd., which owns and operates one of the world's largest fabrication yards, located in Zhuhai, China.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Flow From Operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we remained focused on generating positive cash flow from operations and maintaining our strong balance sheet to support sustaining operations and future growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of 2016, we had $2.1 billion in cash and marketable securities, after returning $118 million in dividends to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a deep commitment to providing a safe workplace for our employees and subcontractors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we improved our performance against leading indicators of safety, which will position us well as we continue to drive a world-class safety culture in 2017 and beyond.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings and Earnings Per Share ("EPS").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net earnings attributable to Fluor from continuing operations were $281 million (or $2.00 per diluted share), down from $418 million (or $2.85 per diluted share) in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings results include transaction, integration and other costs associated with the acquisition of Stork Holding B.V., other organizational realignment expenses, and the impact of adverse tax effects arising from new tax regulations issued at the end of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Results for the year also reflect a continued weakness in commodity prices throughout much of 2016, as well as a $170 million after-tax charge relating to forecast revisions for cost increases on a petrochemical project in the Energy, Chemicals & Mining segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our overriding objective is to pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As shown in the charts below, for 2016, 89% of our Chief Executive Officer's target total direct compensation ("TDC"), and approximately 81% (on average) of the other named executives' target TDC, was in the form of annual or long-term incentives, the value of which is variable (depending on either performance and/or the price of the company's stock).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, our long-term incentives include a mix of restricted stock units ("RSUs") and stock-based performance awards under our VDI program, which were granted to named executives in equal proportions based on the estimated grant date value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The VDI awards are paid in stock and have performance targets calculated over a three-year period tied to average annual EPS and average annual return on operating assets employed ("ROAE").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual incentives are paid in cash and are based primarily on the achievement of pre-established financial and operational performance goals for each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Target TDC(1)   Other Named Executives' Target TDC(1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) TDC consists of base pay, target annual incentive, and long-term incentive values at the time of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Realizable Pay for our Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below illustrates our Chief Executive Officer's "realizable" compensation as compared to his target TDC, averaged over the last three fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that t is important to show realizable compensation because it provides valuable supplemental information to assist our stockholders in understanding our executive compensation rogram.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Realizable compensation shows the value of the compensation our Chief Executive Officer actually earned or could expect to earn as of the end of 2016, while target TDC represents his target compensation opportunity at the time of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While both target TDC and realizable compensation include actual base salaries, realizable compensation reflects both
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) performance against goals that impact annual incentives and VDI awards and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On average, over the last three years, our annual incentives have paid out close to target, demonstrating that we have performed reasonably well against challenging goals in a difficult economic environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By comparison, the realizable value of our long-term incentives is significantly below the target opportunity due to a combination of both performance and stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, none of the options granted to named executives in the last three years have any value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As shown in the graph below, average realizable compensation for our Chief Executive Officer for the three-year period was 24% lower than his target TDC, which we believe demonstrates strong alignment between our compensation program and the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) actual base salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the value of other long-term incentive awards on the vesting date (if vested) or on December 31, 2016 (if unvested), as further discussed in the Outstanding Equity Awards at 2016 Fiscal Year End table on pages 46-47.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Actions for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making decisions regarding the compensation opportunities for the named executives in 2016, the Committee took into account market conditions and performance, and also considered market data for our compensation peer group (as described on page 36, the "Compensation Peer Group") and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: general industry peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee took the following specific actions with respect to named executive compensation for 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approved 2016 base salaries that were the same as 2015 base salaries;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approved 2016 target bonus percentages that were the same as 2015 target bonus percentages, while maintaining the design of the annual incentive program;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased the percentage of long-term incentive awards granted in the form of performance-based VDI awards to one half of the total long-term incentive award and granted the other half in RSUs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Made the 2016 RSU grants and VDI awards subject to a three-year post-vest holding requirement; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 VDI awards, changed the performance measurement for EPS to three one-year periods, rather than a cumulative three-year period, to provide greater precision and rigor in goal setting in a volatile market for currency exchange rates, commodity prices and other economic factors that are outside our control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation policies reflect our strong focus on sound corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As in prior years, the following practices and policies were in effect during 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What we do We maintain robust stock ownership guidelines, including a 6x base salary requirement for the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide single trigger change in control agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a clawback policy for performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have excise tax gross-ups for change in control agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design compensation programs that do not encourage imprudent risk-taking; and the Committee conducts an annual compensation risk assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not allow repricing of stock options without stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not allow the payment of dividends or dividend equivalents on unvested performance awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engage an independent compensation consultant for our fully independent Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have individual employment agreements for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit hedging, pledging and short-term trading of company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Named Executive Compensation is Tied to Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use a balanced approach to compensation with a variety of pay elements to reward the achievement of both short-term and long-term goals, the majority of which are directly linked to performance as described in the table below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Component     Primary Purpose     Linkage to Performance      Base Salaries    Provide a market competitive, stable level of income to attract and retain top talent    Individual responsibility, performance and contributions to the company, overall salary movements in the Compensation Peer Group and the company's salary budget are considered by the Board or the Committee, as applicable, in determining an appropriate salary adjustment each year      Annual Incentive Awards    Provide annual cash compensation for achievement of performance goals that drive near- term objectives and support long-term company value:  Net earnings  Cash flow from operations  Safety  Strategic operating objectives    Annual forecasts of net earnings and other factors are made at the beginning of each fiscal year, and are used to set the target achievement levels for the annual incentive awards The annual incentive awards are completely at risk, depending on the level of performance against the criteria      Long-Term Incentives    Value Driver Incentive Performance Units                Provide a stock-based long-term retention vehicle that is linked to performance measures that focus named executives on the creation of long-term company value    Forecasts for the performance measures are made at the beginning of each year, and performance units are earned to the extent those expectations are met, on average, over a three- year period VDI awards are earned and vest at the end of a three-year performance period and are required to be held for another three years after vesting, aligning the interests of executives with those of our stockholders by focusing the executives on the company's financial performance over a multi-year period The units are completely at risk, depending on our performance against the relevant measures (and our stock price)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Component     Primary Purpose     Linkage to Performance           Stock Options                   Provide a long-term retention vehicle that is directly linked to stockholder value creation over time    Although no stock options were granted in 2016, they typically vest in equal thirds over three years, aligning the interests of executives with those of our stockholders by focusing the executives on long-term stockholder value creation The options are completely at risk, attaining value only if our stock price grows over the initial grant price           Restricted Stock Units                   Provide a long-term equity ownership and retention vehicle that is directly linked to stockholder value creation over time    RSUs vest in equal thirds over three years and are required to be held for another three years after vesting, aligning the interests of executives with those of our stockholders by focusing the executives on the company's financial performance over a multi-year period The value of the RSUs is at risk, increasing or decreasing with our stock price over the vesting period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Components of 2016 Named Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company provides named executives with base salaries that provide a competitive, stable level of income, since most other elements of their compensation are at-risk based on company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining base salaries for positions held by named executives, the Committee generally targets the 50th percentile (i.e., the median) for similar types of executives within the Compensation Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries may deviate from the median to attract key talent and for named executives with varying levels of experience or specialized duties or skill sets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews base salaries for named executives annually and upon a change in responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating the Chief Executive Officer's base salary and his recommendations for the base salaries of the other named executives, the Committee considered the following factors during its 2016 annual review:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Compensation Peer Group data and other general industry survey data for comparable positions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: individual level of responsibility, performance and contributions to the company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: internal pay equity based on relative duties and responsibilities; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the company's 2016 salary budget.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 base salaries for the named executives did not change from 2015 and were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive       2016 Base Salary     David T. Seaton     $1,295,000    Biggs C. Porter      $841,300    Peter Oosterveer     $700,000    Carlos M. Hernandez      $630,000    Bruce A. Stanski     $600,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the base salaries for Mr. Seaton, Mr. Oosterveer, Mr. Hernandez and Mr. Stanski approximated or were slightly lower than the median of the Compensation Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Porter's base salary was in the top quartile of chief financial officers within the Compensation Peer Group, reflecting his years of experience in numerous finance positions (including chief financial officer) and the salary we originally offered to recruit him to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash-based annual incentives are provided to motivate and reward named executives for achieving annual performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each named executive participates in the Fluor Corporation Amended and Restated 2008 Executive Performance Incentive Plan (the "Performance Plan") and has a target annual incentive amount, established as a percentage of annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This percentage reflects each executive's respective organizational level, position and responsibility for achievement of the company's strategic goals, and aligns with market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, target bonus percentages for Messrs. Seaton, Oosterveer and Stanski approximated the median target bonus percentages for executives with similar job responsibilities within the Compensation Peer Group, while the target bonus percentages for Messrs. Porter and Hernandez were below the median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the target bonus percentages for named executives changed from 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target annual incentives for 2016 for each named executive were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive       Percentage of Base Salary       Target Annual Incentive Amount       David T. Seaton     145%    $1,878,000     Biggs C. Porter      85%     $715,200       Peter Oosterveer     100%    $700,000    Carlos M. Hernandez      85%     $535,500       Bruce A. Stanski     85%    $510,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A named executive may receive from zero to 200% of the target annual incentive amount, depending on whether the company and the named executive meet, fail to meet o exceed certain performance measures relating to overall company performance, the individual's own performance and, for Messrs. Oosterveer and Stanksi, the performance of t business operations they oversee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The types of measures and relative weightings of those measures are determined by the Committee each year and are tailored to the named executive's position and organizational responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance measures have remained fairly consistent over the past five years, but, in 2015, the Committee replaced ROAE with cash flow from operations in light of its determination to include ROAE as a performance measure under the VDI program, as discussed further below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has also adjusted the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: measures' relative weightings from time to time to reflect the Committee's emphasis on particular goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When determining the performance measures, the Committee considers the company's annual operating plan and strategic priorities for the upcoming year, as well as the company's performance in the previous year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance measures are all objective except for the individual performance measure, which is subjective and not subject to specific targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of multiple financial goals prevents an overemphasis on any one financial metric and together focus the named executives on key areas of importance to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The measures, along with their respective weightings, for each named executive were as follows:

Stanski       Corporate Net Earnings     60%    55%    35%    55%    35%     Cash Flow from Operations     20%    20%    20%    20%    20%      Safety(1)                           Days Away, Restricted and Transfer Incidence Rate     3%    3%    3%    3%    3%       Total Recordable Case Incidence Rate     3%    3%    3%    3%    3%      HSE Audit Score     4%    4%    4%    4%    4%       Energy, Chemicals & Mining, Industrial, Infrastructure & Power, Power Services and AMECO EBIT (Segment Profit)(2)             20%             Government EBIT (Segment Profit)                     20%      Individual Performance     10%    15%    15%    15%    15%

sentences.text: Performance Measures for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance measures for the 2016 annual incentive awards for the named executives are described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate net earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate net earnings is defined as the amount of net earnings attributable to Fluor from continuing operations set forth in our financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When establishing corporate net earnings targets for 2016, the Committee determined that the following items would be excluded from net earnings for purposes of determining achievement of the target: the financial impact of any acquisition activity (including integration costs and other expenses), expenses associated with restructuring programs and unusual expenses outside the normal course of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the financial impact of Stork Holding B.V., which was acquired in 2016 and not considered when setting the targets, certain expenses associated with company restructuring activities and the impact of year-end changes to U.S. tax regulations have been excluded from the earnings calculation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Flow From Operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash flow from operations is defined as total segment profit plus the fiscal year change in the business unit project working capital accounts (accounts receivable, work in progress, advance billings and accounts payable).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When setting targets, the Committee determined to exclude the financial impact of any acquisition from this measure as well.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, the financial results of Stork Holding B.V. are not included for purposes of determining the achievement of the targets for this measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety consists of three distinct measures:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Fluor's days away, restricted and transfer ("DART") incidence rate,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Fluor's total recordable case incidence rate and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) Fluor's health, safety and environmental ("HSE") audit score.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety metrics for 2016 exclude the operations of Stork Holding B.V. and COOEC Fluor Heavy Industries Co., Ltd., which were acquired or formed in 2016, and two contracts for which the company assumed responsibility in early 2016, in accordance with the Committee's directions when setting targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fluor's DART incidence rate is defined as a work-related injury or illness that involves days away from work beyond the day of injury or onset of the illness or otherwise results in a work restriction or work transfer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fluor's total recordable case incidence rate is defined as a work-related injury or illness that results in one or more of the following: days away from work, restricted work or transfer to another job, medical treatment beyond first aid, loss of consciousness, a significant injury or illness diagnosed by a physician or other licensed health care professional, or death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incidence rates for both measures represent the number of recordable cases per 100 full-time workers (working 40 hours per week, 50 weeks per year), and are calculated using the following equation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fluor's HSE audit score measures our performance against approximately 60 leading indicators in the critical areas that drive performance and safety on our projects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each indicator is given a score by the HSE corporate audit team based on project performance, with the overall score being the average of the scores for all indicators across a sampling of projects and joint ventures in all business lines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company audits only those joint ventures for which the company has sole or joint HSE responsibilities for program development and work control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Group EBIT (Segment Profit).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Group Earnings Before Interest and Tax ("EBIT"), the profit measure used for compensation purposes, is typically the same as segment profit, the profit measure reported externally in our financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Segment profit is calculated as revenue less cost of revenue and earnings attributable to noncontrolling interests excluding: corporate general and administrative expense; interest expense; interest income; domestic and foreign income taxes; other non-operating income and expense items; and loss from discontinued operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Group segment profit results can be found on page F-47 of our annual report on Form 10-K as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on February 17, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the group EBIT goals were reclassified to be consistent with segment reporting changes reflected in our financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The group EBIT (segment profit) measure for Mr. Oosterveer excludes the effects of NuScale Power, LLC, since he was not responsible for those operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all named executives other than the Chief Executive Officer, the individual measure is given a rating based on subjective evaluations and recommendations by the Chief Executive Officer, although ultimately subject to the discretion of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of the Chief Executive Officer, individual performance is assessed by the independent directors of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
