sentences.text: U.S. Federal Income Tax Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following discussion of the U.S. federal income tax consequences of the 2017 Plan is intended to be a summary of applicable U.S. federal law as currently in effect.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: State and local tax consequences may differ and may be amended or interpreted differently during the term of the 2017 Plan or of stock options granted under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the U.S. federal income tax rules governing stock options and related payments are complex and subject to frequent change, optionees are advised to consult their tax advisors prior to exercise of stock options or dispositions of stock acquired pursuant to option exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive stock options and non-qualified stock options are treated differently for U.S. federal income tax purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive stock options are intended to comply with the requirements of Section 422 of the IRC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-qualified stock options need not comply with such requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An optionee is not taxed on the grant or exercise of an incentive stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The difference between the exercise price and the fair market value of the shares on the exercise date, however, will be taken into account for purposes of the alternative minimum tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an optionee holds the shares acquired upon exercise of an incentive stock option for at least two years following the option grant date and at least one year following exercise, the optionee's gain, if any, upon a subsequent disposition of such shares is long term capital gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The measure of the gain is the difference between the proceeds received on disposition and the optionee's basis in the shares (which generally equals the exercise price).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an optionee disposes of stock acquired pursuant to exercise of an incentive stock option before satisfying the one- and two-year holding periods described above, the optionee may recognize both ordinary income and capital gain in the year of disposition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of the ordinary income will be the lesser of the amount realized on disposition or the fair market value of the stock on the exercise date reduced in both instances by the exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The excess of the consideration received on such a disposition over the lesser of the amount realized on disposition or the fair market value of the stock on the exercise date will generally be long term capital gain if the stock had been held for more than one year following exercise of the incentive stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company is not entitled to an income tax deduction on the grant or exercise of an incentive stock option or on the optionee's disposition of the shares after satisfying the holding period requirement described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the holding periods are not satisfied, the company will be entitled to a deduction in the year the optionee disposes of the shares in an amount equal to the ordinary income recognized by the optionee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Qualified Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An optionee is not taxed on the grant of a non-qualified stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On exercise, however, the optionee recognizes ordinary income equal to the excess of the fair market value of the shares acquired on the date of exercise over the exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company is entitled to an income tax deduction in the year of exercise in the amount recognized by the optionee as ordinary income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any gain on subsequent disposition of the shares is long term capital gain if the shares are held for more than one year following exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company does not receive a deduction for this gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant will not recognize taxable income upon the grant of an SAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon exercise of an SAR, a participant will recognize taxable ordinary income in an amount equal to the amount of cash received and the difference between the fair market value of the underlying shares on the date of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: xercise and the exercise price of the SAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any additional gain or loss recognized upon any later disposition of the shares would be capital gain or loss.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An employee who receives restricted stock subject to restrictions which create a "substantial risk of forfeiture" (within the meaning of Section 83 of the IRC) will normally realize taxable income on the date the shares become transferable or no longer subject to substantial risk of forfeiture or on the date of their earlier disposition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of such taxable income will be equal to the amount by which the fair market value of the shares of common stock on the date such restrictions lapse (or any earlier date on which the shares become transferable or are disposed of) exceeds their purchase price, if any.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An employee may elect pursuant to Section 83(b) of the IRC, however, to include in income in the year of grant the excess of the fair market value of the shares of common stock (without regard to any restrictions) over their purchase price, if any, on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant will not recognize taxable income upon the grant of a stock unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the distribution of cash or shares to a participant pursuant to the terms of a stock unit, the participant will recognize taxable ordinary income equal to the amount of any cash and/or the fair market value of any shares received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excess Parachute Payments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon accelerated exercisability, vesting, or payment of award contingent upon or in connection with a change of control of the company, certain amounts associated with such awards could, depending upon the individual circumstances of the recipient participant, constitute "excess parachute payments" under the golden parachute provisions of the IRC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to these provisions a participant will be subject to a 20% excise tax on any excess parachute payment and the company may be denied any deduction with respect to such excess parachute payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The limit on the deductibility of compensation under Section 162(m) of the IRC is also reduced by the amount of any excess parachute payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether amounts constitute excess parachute payments depends upon, among other things, the value of the awards accelerated and the past compensation of the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 409A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the intention of the company that awards will comply with Section 409A of the IRC regarding nonqualified deferred compensation arrangements or will satisfy the conditions of applicable exemptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if an award is subject to and fails to comply with the requirements of Section 409A, the participant may recognize ordinary income on the amounts deferred under the award, to the extent vested, prior to the time when the compensation is received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Section 409A imposes a 20% penalty tax, as well as interest, on the participant with respect to such amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Deduction and Section 162(m) of the IRC
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described above, special rules limit the deductibility of compensation paid to the chief executive officer and to each of the next three most highly compensated executive officers, other than the chief financial officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Section 162(m), unless various conditions are met that enable compensation to qualify as "performance-based," the annual compensation paid to any of these specified executives will be deductible only to the extent that it does not exceed $1,000,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the rules and regulations promulgated under Section 162(m) are complicated and subject to change from time to time, sometimes with retroactive effect.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, a number of requirements must be met in order for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: particular compensation to so qualify.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, there can be no assurance that any compensation awarded or paid under the 2017 Plan will be deductible under all circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Plan Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No awards will be granted under the 2017 Plan prior to its approval by the stockholders of Fluor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All awards will be granted at the discretion of the Committee, and, ccordingly, are not yet determinable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 5  RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our commitment to good corporate governance, the Board is asking stockholders to ratify the Audit Committee's appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm to audit the financial statements of the company for the fiscal year ending on December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the stockholders fail to ratify the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP, the Audit Committee will reconsider this appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the appointment is ratified, the Audit Committee, in its discretion may direct the appointment of a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if the Audit Committee determines that such a change would be in the best interests of Fluor and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A representative of Ernst & Young LLP is expected to be present at the meeting and available to respond to appropriate questions and, although that firm has indicated that no statement will be made, an opportunity for a statement will be provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee evaluates the selection of the independent registered public accounting firm each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in order to promote continuing auditor independence, the Audit Committee considers the independence of the firm at least annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conjunction with the mandated rotation of the independent registered public accounting firm's lead engagement partner, the Audit Committee and its chair are also directly involved in the selection of Ernst & Young's new lead engagement partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on their most recent evaluation of Ernst & Young, including the firm's past performance and an assessment of the firm's qualifications and resources, the members of the Audit Committee believe that the continued retention
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of Ernst & Young to serve as the company's independent registered public accounting firm is in the best interests of the company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee's Pre-Approval Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of our Board has policies and procedures that govern the pre-approval of all audit and non-audit services to be provided by our independent registered public accounting firm and prohibit certain services from being provided by our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent registered public accounting firm may not render any audit or non-audit service unless the service is approved in advance by the Audit Committee pursuant to its pre-approval policies and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For any pre-approval, the Audit Committee confirms that such services are consistent with the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board on auditor independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, the Audit Committee may pre-approve services that are expected to be provided to the company by our independent registered public accounting firm during the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management provides the Audit Committee a quarterly report listing services performed by and fees paid to the independent registered public accounting firm during the current fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has delegated authority to the Chair of the Audit Committee to pre-approve any audit or non-audit services to be provided to the company by the independent registered public accounting firm for which the cost is less than $500,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair must report any pre-approval pursuant to the delegation of authority to the Audit Committee at its next scheduled meeting, and the Audit Committee is then asked to approve and ratify the pre-approved service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Recommendation

sentences.text: REPORT OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee assists the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibility for the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: company's accounting, reporting and financial practices, including the integrity of its financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: company's compliance with legal and regulatory requirements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: independent registered public accounting firm's qualifications and independence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performance of the company's internal audit function and independent registered public accounting firm; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: preparation of this report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out these responsibilities, the Audit Committee, among other things, supervises the relationship between the company and its independent registered public accounting firm, including making decisions with respect to its appointment or removal, reviewing the scope of its audit services, pre-approving audit engagement fees and non- audit services and evaluating its independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees and evaluates the adequacy and effectiveness of the company's systems of internal and disclosure controls and oversees the internal audit function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has the authority to investigate any matter brought to its attention and may engage outside counsel for such purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company's management is responsible, among other things, for preparing the financial statements and for the overall financial reporting process, including the company's system of internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent registered public accounting firm's responsibilities include auditing the financial statements and expressing an opinion on the conformity of the audited financial statements with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles and an opinion on the company's internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its oversight of the company's financial statements, the Audit Committee reviewed and discussed with management and Ernst & Young LLP, the company's independent registered public accounting firm, the audited financial statements of the company for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee discussed with Ernst & Young LLP such matters as are required to be discussed under the rules adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board, relating to the conduct of the audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has received the written disclosures and the letter from Ernst & Young LLP required by applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent accountant's communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has discussed with Ernst & Young LLP the registered public accounting firm's independence from the company and its management, and considered the compatibility of non-audit services with the registered public accounting firm's independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its review and discussions referred to above, the Audit Committee has recommended to the Board of Directors that the audited financial statements be included in the company's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, for filing with the Securities and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exchange Commission.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 6  STOCKHOLDER PROPOSAL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fluor has received the following stockholder proposal from The Comptroller of the State of New York (the "Comptroller"), who is the trustee of the New York State Common Retirement Fund (the "Fund").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Comptroller is located at 59 Maiden Lane  30th Floor, New York, NY 10038.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to information that the Comptroller provided to the company, the Fund owned 324,950 shares of our common stock as of the date the Comptroller submitted the proposal to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPTROLLER'S PROPOSAL AND SUPPORTING STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED:    Shareholders request that Fluor Corporation adopt time bound quantitative, company-wide goals for the reduction of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, taking into consideration the most recent Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) guidance for reducing total GHG emissions, and issue a report by December 2017, at reasonable cost and omitting proprietary information, on its plans to achieve these goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting strategies to achieve the GHG goals, we recommend consideration of enhancing the energy efficiency of Fluor's operations (wherever profitable) and sourcing renewable energy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to mitigate the worst impacts of climate change, the IPCC estimates that a 55 percent reduction in GHG emissions globally is needed by 2050 (relative to 2010 levels) to stabilize global temperatures, entailing a US target reduction of 80 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The costs of failing to address climate change are significant and estimated to have an average value at risk of $4.2 trillion globally  representing 6% of the current market capitalization of all the world's stock markets (The Economist, Intelligence Unit, 2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risky Business: The Economic Risks of Climate Change in the United States (2014), an analysis of climate change impacts, found serious economic effects including property damage, shifting agricultural patterns, reduced labor productivity, and increased energy costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These effects could substantially impact a company's business operations, revenue or expenditures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Setting GHG emission targets is widespread among US companies and can have positive financial outcomes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More than 60 percent of Fortune 100 companies have GHG reduction commitments, renewable energy commitments, or both.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A report published by WWF, Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP), and McKinsey & Company, The 3% Solution: Driving Profits Through Carbon Reduction (2015), found tha companies with GHG targets achieved an average of 9% better return on investment than companies without targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the 79% of companies in the S&P 500 that report to CDP earned a higher return on their carbon reduction investments than on their overall corporate capital investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, the 53 Fortune 100 companies reporting on climate change and energy targets to CDP are saving $1.1 billion annually through their emission reductions and renewable energy initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These goals enable companies to reduce costs, build resilient supply chains, and manage operational and reputational risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electricity costs from sources such as wind and solar have declined rapidly and are now cheaper in some regions than fossil fuel-based energy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, Berkshire Hathaway's NV Energy secured a power purchase agreement (PPA) price of 3.87 cents per kWh for electricity generated by a 100 Megawatt First Solar project.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, longterm wind and solar PPA's (used by companies like Apple), with fixed prices, can help companies reduce the volatility energy costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD OF DIRECTORS' STATEMENT IN OPPOSITION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors agrees that the reduction of greenhouse gas ("GHG") emissions is an important issue for the company to consider in conducting operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, the company already reports its GHG emission information to our stakeholders and to the CDP, the world's largest database of corporate climate change information, as described further below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote "AGAINST" this stockholder proposal because it believes that additional disclosure of strict GHG emissions goals would not provide significant incremental benefits to the company, its stockholders or the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reporting Greenhouse Gas Emissions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has tracked GHG emissions arising from its offices, vehicle fleets at those offices and air travel since 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To drive accountability and verify transparency in our global operations, we proactively report our GHG emission information to our stakeholders in the Sustainability section of our website (www.fluor.com) and to the CDP for use by financial and policy decision-makers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our 2015 Sustainability Report, which is available in the Sustainability section of our website, we note that over the period that Fluor has collected GHG emissions data, there has been a 28% reduction in our normalized carbon footprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategies to Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fluor's facilities consist primarily of office space.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using the carbon footprint information we collect, the company continues to identify appropriate ways to reduce carbon emissions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted in the Sustainability section of our website, the company has implemented a number of programs to manage its global footprint, including
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) energy reduction through energy-efficient lighting, low power use modality computers and monitors, and programmable thermostats for heating for both new construction and retrofits;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) recycling programs including paper products, metals, cooking oils and light bulbs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) reuse of office supplies such as work stations, carpeting, binders and furniture;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) water use reductions, including automatic flow faucets and grey irrigation water; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) travel and commuting reductions with carpools, office shuttles, bicycling initiatives and support of public transportation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Goals For the Reduction of Greenhouse Gas Emissions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We manage our greenhouse gas emissions, use of renewable energy and energy efficiency on a facility-by-facility basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we have received LEED (or similar) certifications for a number of our facilities around the world, as highlighted in our Sustainability Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that setting company-wide goals for the reduction of GHG emissions does not allow facility management the full flexibility that is necessary to reduce environmental impact, increase energy efficiency and employ renewable energy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, our current approach allows local management around the globe to institute the best initiatives for their facilities and has resulted in our superior performance, which is the ultimate indicator of how well a program is designed and executed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Creating Technology to Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company is also committed to helping reduce GHG emissions through its investment in Nuscale Power, LLC, a leader in the development of light water, passively safe small modular reactors ("SMRs").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SMRs can help achieve carbon reduction while playing a significant role in meeting future energy demands.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to the IPCC Working Group III, reducing the carbon intensity of electrical generation is a key component of a cost effective mitigation strategy in achieving a low carbon stabilization level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nuclear energy is cited as having the potential to make an increasing contribution to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: low carbon energy supply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe NuScale can be a leader in providing a key technology that will assist in reducing GHG emissions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company maintains its commitment to the reduction of GHG emissions by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) reporting our GHG emissions in our Sustainability Report and to the CDP;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) pursuing internal efforts to reduce emissions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) continuing to develop innovative technologies that can play a large role in addressing climate change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not believe that establishing future company-wide goals and reporting on those goals is necessary to further these efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote AGAINST the stockholder proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the company's Amended and Restated Bylaws, stockholders may nominate directors or bring other business before an annual meeting if written notice is delivered to the company's Secretary (containing certain information specified in the Amended and Restated Bylaws about the stockholder and the proposed action) not later than the close of business on the 90th day nor earlier than the close of business on the 120th day prior to the first anniversary of the preceding year's annual meeting  that is, with respect to the 2018 annual meeting, between January 4, 2018 and February 3, 2018, assuming the date of the 2018 annual meeting is not changed by more than 30 days before or more than 70 days after the first anniversary of the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These requirements are separate from the company's proxy access procedures and the Securities and Exchange Commission's requirements that a stockholder must meet in order to have a stockholder proposal included in the company's proxy statement (which are described below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any notices should be sent to: Carlos M. Hernandez, Chief Legal Officer and Secretary, Fluor Corporation, 6700 Las Colinas Boulevard, Irving, Texas 75039.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chairman of the meeting may refuse to acknowledge or introduce any stockholder proposal or nomination if notice thereof is not received within the applicable deadlines or does not comply with the Amended and Restated Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a stockholder fails to meet these deadlines or fails to satisfy the requirements of Rule 14a-4 under the Exchange Act, the company may exercise discretionary voting authority under proxies it solicits to vote on any such proposal as it determines appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Access Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company's Amended and Restated Bylaws permit a stockholder, or group of up to 20 stockholders, owning continuously for at least three years shares of Fluor stock representing an aggregate of at least 3% of our outstanding shares, to nominate and include in the company's proxy materials director nominees constituting up to the greater of two or 20% of the company's Board, provided that the stockholder(s) and nominee(s) satisfy the requirements in our Amended and Restated Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Written notice of proxy access director nominees must be received not later than the close of business on the 120th day nor earlier than the close of business on the 150th day prior to the first anniversary of the date the definitive proxy statement was first sent to stockholders in connection with the preceding year's annual meeting  that is, with respect to the 2018 annual meeting, between October 10, 2017 and November 9, 2017, assuming the date of the 2018 annual meeting is not changed by more than 30 days before or after the first anniversary of the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any notices should be addressed to Carlos M. Hernandez, Chief Legal Officer and Secretary, Fluor Corporation, 6700 Las Colinas Boulevard, Irving, Texas 75039.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Proposals for the 2018 Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders interested in submitting a Rule 14a-8 proposal for inclusion in the proxy materials for the annual meeting of stockholders in 2018 may do so by following the procedures prescribed in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rule 14a-8, under the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be eligible for inclusion, stockholder proposals must be received by the company's Secretary no later than the close of business on November 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any proposals should be sent to: Carlos M. Hernandez, Chief Legal Officer and Secretary, Fluor Corporation, 6700 Las Colinas Boulevard, Irving, Texas 75039.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electronic Voting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of the Internet or telephonic voting procedures described on page 91 of this proxy statement constitutes your authorization for Broadridge Financial Solutions, or in th case of shares held in company retirement plans, the trustee, to deliver a proxy card on your behalf to vote at the Annual Meeting in accordance with your Internet or telephonically communicated instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stockholder who would like a copy of our 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K may obtain one, without charge, by addressing a request to the Corporate Secretary, Fluor Corporation, 6700 Las Colinas Boulevard, Irving, TX 75039.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also obtain access to a copy of the Form 10-K in the investor relations section o our website at www.fluor.com by clicking on "Financial Information" and "SEC Filings."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE ANNUAL MEETING AND VOTING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive a notice regarding Internet availability of proxy materials instead of a full set of printed materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As permitted by Securities and Exchange Commission rules, we are making this proxy statement and our annual report available to our stockholders primarily via the Internet, rather than mailing printed copies of these materials to each stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this process will expedite stockholders' receipt of proxy materials, lower the costs of the Annual Meeting and help to conserve natural resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each stockholder (other than those who previously requested electronic delivery of all materials or previously elected to receive a paper copy of the proxy materials) will receive a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the "Notice") containing instructions on how to access and review the proxy materials, including our proxy statement and our annual report, on the Internet and how to access an electronic proxy card to vote on the Internet or by phone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice also contains instructions on how to receive a paper copy of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you receive a Notice, you will not receive a printed copy of the proxy materials unless you request one.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you receive a Notice and would like to receive a printed copy of our proxy materials, please follow the instructions included in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is entitled to vote at the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors set March 7, 2017 as the record date for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you were a stockholder of record at the close of business on March 7, 2017, you are entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What are my voting rights?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders have one vote for each share of Fluor common stock owned by them as of the close of business on March 7, 2017, the record date, with respect to all business of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no cumulative voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many shares must be present to hold a meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On March 7, 2017, the company had 139,736,696 shares of common stock outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence at the meeting, in person or by proxy, of a majority of the outstanding shares of Fluor common stock on the record date will constitute a quorum at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes (broker-held shares for which the brokers have not received voting instructions from clients and with respect to which the brokers do not have discretionary authority to vote on a matter) are counted for purposes of determining the presence or absence of a quorum for the transaction of business at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote my shares?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record as of the record date, you may authorize the voting of your shares in any of the following ways by following the instructions in the Notice:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: over the Internet at www.proxyvote.com;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: telephonically by calling 1-800-690-6903;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: by completing, signing and mailing the printed proxy card, if you requested a paper copy of the proxy materials; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Authorizations submitted over the Internet or by phone must be received by 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Daylight Time on May 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the shares you own are held in "street name" by a bank, brokerage firm or other nominee, that nominee may provide you with a Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Follow the instructions on the Notice to access our proxy materials and vote online, or to request a paper or email copy of our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you receive these materials in paper form, a voting instruction card is included so you can instruct your bank, broker or other nominee how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that if your shares are held in street name by a bank, brokerage firm or other nominee and you wish to vote in person at the Annual Meeting, you must first obtain a legal proxy issued in your name from the bank, brokerage firm or other nominee that holds your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote if my shares are held in company retirement plans?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold any shares in the company retirement plans, you are receiving, or are being provided access to, the same proxy materials as any other stockholder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, your proxy vote will serve as voting instructions to The Northern Trust Company, as trustee of the plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If voting instructions (or any revocation or change of voting instructions) are not received by the trustee by 5:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Daylight Time on May 2, 2017, or if you do not provide properly completed and executed voting instructions, any shares you hold in the company retirement plans will be voted by the trustee in favor of the thirteen nominees for director, and in proportion to the manner in which the other company retirement plan participants vote their shares with respect to the other proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What vote is required for the election of directors and the other proposals?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1  Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee receiving the majority of votes cast (number of shares voted "for" a director nominee must exceed the number of shares voted "against" that director nominee) will be elected as a director, provided that if the number of nominees exceeds the number of directors to be elected (a situation we do not anticipate), the directors shall be elected by a plurality of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes are not counted in the determination of votes cast, and thus do not have an effect on the outcome of voting for directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals 2, 3 and 5  Executive Compensation and Auditors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Proposals 2, 3 and 5, the affirmative vote of the majority of shares represented in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote is required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions have the same effect as a vote "against" Proposals 2, 3 and 5, and broker non-votes (if applicable) do not have an effect on the outcome of these proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these votes is advisory, and the Board will give consideration to the voting results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 4  Equity Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Proposal 4, the affirmative vote of the majority of shares represented in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote is required to approve the Fluor Corporation 2017 Performance Incentive Plan, which also requires approval of a majority of the votes cast under NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In both cases, abstentions have the same effect as a vote "against" the proposal and broker non-votes do not have an effect on the outcome of the proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 6  Stockholder Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Proposal 6, the affirmative vote of the majority of shares represented in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote is required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions have the same effect as a vote "against" Proposal 6, and broker non-votes do not have an effect on the outcome of this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker Discretionary Voting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in street name and you do not provide voting instructions to your broker in advance of the Annual Meeting, New York Stock Exchange rules grant your broker discretionary authority to vote on "routine matters," including the ratification of the independent auditors (Proposal 5).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the proposals regarding the election of directors, the advisory vote to approve executive compensation, the advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory votes to approve executive compensation, the approval of the Fluor Corporation 2017 Performance Incentive Plan and the stockholder proposal are not considered "routine matters."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, if you hold your shares of company common stock in street name and do not provide voting instructions to your broker, your shares will not be voted on Proposals 1, 2, 3, 4 and 6.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge you to promptly provide voting instructions to your broker to ensure that your shares are voted on these proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please follow the instructions set forth in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What if I do not specify how I want my shares voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For shares other than shares held in the Fluor retirement plans or held in street name, if you properly submit a proxy without giving specific voting instructions, the proxyholders named therein will vote in accordance with the recommendation of the Board of Directors (1) FOR the election of the thirteen director nominees listed above, (2) FOR the advisory resolution to approve executive compensation, (3) FOR the approval, on an advisory basis, of the option of every "one year" as the frequency of future advisory votes to approve executive compensation, (4) FOR the approval of the Fluor Corporation 2017 Performance Incentive Plan, (5) FOR the ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending December 31, 2017 and (6) AGAINST the stockholder proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As to any other business that may properly come before the meeting, the proxyholders will vote in accordance with their best judgment, although the company does not presently know of any other business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I revoke my proxy or change my vote after submitting my proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For shares held of record, you may revoke your proxy or change your voting instructions by submitting a later-dated vote in person at the Annual Meeting, via the Internet, by phone or by delivering written notice to the Secretary of the company at any time prior to 24 hours before the commencement of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attending the meeting will not revoke your proxy unless you specifically request to revoke it or submit a ballot at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a participant in Fluor's retirement plans, you may revoke your proxy and change your vote, but only until 5:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Daylight Time on May 2, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the shares you own are held in street name by a bank, brokerage firm or other nominee, you should contact that nominee if you wish to revoke or change previously given voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I attend the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the Annual Meeting is limited to stockholders of the company as of the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may be asked to present valid, government-issued picture identification, such as a driver's license or passport, before being admitted to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares in street name, you also will need proof of ownership to be admitted to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A recent brokerage statement or letter from your broker or other nominee are examples of proof of ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each stockholder may appoint only one proxy holder or representative to attend the meeting on his or her behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please let us know whether you plan to attend the meeting by responding affirmatively when prompted during telephone or Internet voting or by marking the attendance box on the proxy card or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carlos M. Hernandez Executive Vice President, Chief Legal Officer and Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 9, 2017 Irving, Texas
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annex A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FLUOR CORPORATION 2017 PERFORMANCE INCENTIVE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose of Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Fluor Corporation 2017 Performance Incentive Plan (the "Plan") is to enable the Company, as defined in Section 2.2(a)(ii) hereof, to attract, retain and motivate its officers, executives, management, non-employee directors and other key personnel, to further align the interests of such persons with those of the stockholders of the Company, by providing for or increasing their proprietary interest in the Company, and to help promote a pay-for-performance linkage for such persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administration of the Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.1    Composition of Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan shall be administered by the Organization and Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company and/or by he Board of Directors of the Company (the "Board of Directors") or another committee of the Board of Directors, as appointed from time to time by the Board of Directors (any uch administrative body, the "Committee").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors shall fill vacancies on, and may remove from or add members to, the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall act ursuant to a majority vote or unanimous written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an award granted under the Plan (an "Award") is intended to satisfy the conditions of Section 162(m)(4)(C) of the nternal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the "Code"), then approval of such grant shall be required to be made solely by Committee members who are "outside directors" as escribed in the Treasury regulations under Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that any permitted action taken by the Board of Directors conflicts with action taken by the ommittee, the Board of Directors action shall control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.2    Powers of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the express provisions of this Plan, the Committee shall be authorized and empowered to do all things necessary or desirable in onnection with the administration of this Plan with respect to the Awards over which such Committee has authority, including, without limitation, the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)   to prescribe, amend and rescind rules and regulations relating to this Plan and to define terms not otherwise defined herein; provided that, unless the Committee shall specify otherwise, for purposes of this Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the term "fair market value" shall mean, as of any date, the closing price per share at which the Shares (as defined in Section 3.1 hereof) are sold in the regular way on the New York Stock Exchange or, if no Shares are traded on the New York Stock Exchange on the date in question, the for the next preceding date for which Shares are traded on the New York Stock Exchange; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the term "Company" shall mean Fluor Corporation, a Delaware corporation, and its subsidiaries and affiliates, unless the context otherwise requires.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)   to determine which persons are Eligible Participant (as defined in Section 4 hereof), to which of such Eligible Participants, if any, Awards shall be granted hereunder, to make Awards under the Plan and to determine the terms of such Awards and the timing of any such Awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c)   to determine the number of Shares subject to Awards and the exercise or purchase price of such Shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)   to establish and verify the extent of satisfaction of any performance goals applicable to Awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e)   to determine the vesting, exercisability, transferability, and payment of Awards, including the authority to accelerate the vesting of Awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f)    to prescribe and amend the terms of the agreements or other documents evidencing Awards made under this Plan (which need not be identical);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g)   to determine the extent to which adjustments are required pursuant to Section 13 hereof;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h)   to interpret and construe this Plan, any rules and regulations under the Plan and the terms and conditions of any Award granted hereunder, and to make exceptions to any such provisions in good faith and for the benefit of the Plan, Participants (as defined in Section 4 hereof) and the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i)    to approve corrections in the documentation or administration of any Award;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (j)    to establish subplans for the grant of Awards to Participants who are foreign nationals or are employed or provide service outside the U.S., which subplans may provide for different terms and conditions applicable to Awards if necessary or desirable to recognize differences in local law or tax policy;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k)   to address unanticipated events (including any temporary closure of the stock exchange on which the Company is listed, disruption of communications or natural catastrophe); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l)    to make all other determinations deemed necessary or advisable for the administration of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.3    Determinations of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All decisions, determinations and interpretations by the Committee or the Board of Directors regarding the Plan shall be final and binding on all Eligible Participants and Participants (as defined in Section 4 hereof).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee or the Board of Directors, as applicable, shall consider such factors as it deems relevant, in its sole and absolute discretion, to making such decisions, determinations and interpretations including, without limitation, the recommendations or advice of any officer or other employee of the Company and such attorneys, consultants and accountants as it may select.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.4    Delegation of Authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing and to the extent consistent with applicable law, the Committee may appoint one or more separate committees (any such committee, a "Subcommittee") composed of one or more directors of the Company (who may but need not be members of the Committee) or officers of the Company (who may but need not be members of the Board of Directors), and may delegate to any such Subcommittee(s) the authority to grant Awards (as defined below) under the Plan to Eligible Participants (as defined below) who are not Section 16 officers or non-employee directors of the Company, to determine all terms of such Awards, and/or to administer the Plan or any aspect of it; provided, however, that if the Subcommittee is composed of one or more officers of the Company who are not members of the Board of Directors, the resolution so authorizing such Subcommittee shall specify the total number of shares subject to such Awards (if any) such Subcommittee may award pursuant to such delegated authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No such officer shall designate himself or herself as a recipient of any Awards granted under authority delegated to such officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any action taken by a Subcommittee within the scope of such delegation shall be deemed for all purposes to have been taken by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.5    Execution of Document and Provision of Assistance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee hereby designates the Secretary of the Company and the head of the Company's human resource function to assist the Committee in the administration of the Plan and execute agreements evidencing Awards made under this Plan or other documents entered into under this Plan on behalf of the Committee or the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee may designate other Company employees to assist the Committee in the administration of the Plan, and may grant authority to such persons to execute agreements evidencing Awards made under this Plan or other documents entered into under this Plan on behalf of the Committee or the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.6    Uniformity Not Required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms and conditions that apply to Awards (including but not limited to the forms of award agreements) need not be uniform among al Awards, among all Awards of the same type, among all Awards granted to the same Participant, or among all Awards granted at the same time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Subject to Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.1    Number of Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)   As of the Effective Date (as defined below), subject to adjustment as provided in Section 13, a total of 12,200,000 shares of the Company's common stock, $0.01 par value ("Shares") shall be authorized for Awards granted under the Plan, less one (1) Share for every one (1) Share that was subject to an Option or Stock Appreciation Right granted after February 24, 2017 and prior to the Effective Date under the Company's Amended & Restated 2008 Executive Performance Incentive Plan (the "2008 Plan") and 3.0 Shares for every one (1) Share that was subject to an award other than an option or stock appreciation right granted after February 24, 2017 and prior to the Effective Date under the 2008 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Shares that are subject to Options or Stock Appreciation Rights shall be counted against this limit as one (1) Share for every one (1) Share granted, and any Shares that are subject to Awards other than Options or Stock Appreciation Rights shall be counted against this limit as 3.0 Shares for every one (1) Share granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the Effective Date, no awards may be granted under the Company's 2000 Executive Performance Incentive Plan, the Company's 2000 Restricted Stock Plan for Non-Employee Directors, the Company's 2001 Key Employee Performance Incentive Plan, the Company's 2003 Executive Performance Incentive Plan, the 2008 Plan and the Company's 2014 Restricted Stock Plan for Non-Employee Directors (collectively, the "Prior Plans").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)   If
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any Shares subject to an Award are forfeited, an Award expires or an Award is settled for cash (in whole or in part), or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) after February 24, 2017 any Shares subject to an award under any Prior Plan are forfeited, or an award under any Prior Plan expires or is settled for cash (in whole or in part), then in each such case the Shares subject to such Award or award under any Prior Plan shall, to the extent of such forfeiture, expiration or cash settlement, be added to the Shares available for Awards under the Plan, in accordance with Section 3.1(c) below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that withholding tax liabilities arising from an Award other than an Option or Stock Appreciation Right or, after February 24, 2017, an award other than an option or stock appreciation right under any Prior Plan are satisfied by the tendering of Shares (either actually or by attestation) or by the withholding of Shares by the Company, the Shares so tendered or withheld shall be added to the Shares available for Awards under the Plan in accordance with Section 3.1(c) below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, the following Shares shall not be added to the Shares authorized for grant under paragraph (a) of this Section:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Shares tendered by the Participant or withheld by the Company in payment of the purchase price of an Option or after February 24, 2017, an option under any Prior Plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Shares tendered by the Participant or withheld by the Company to satisfy any tax withholding obligation with respect to Options or Stock Appreciation Rights or after February 24, 2017, options or stock appreciation rights under any Prior Plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) Shares subject to a Stock Appreciation Right or after February 24, 2017, a stock appreciation right under any Prior Plan that are not issued in connection with its stock settlement on exercise thereof, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) Shares reacquired by the Company on the open market or otherwise using cash proceeds from the exercise of Options or after February 24, 2017, options under any Prior Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c)   Any Shares that again become available for Awards under the Plan pursuant to this Section shall be added as
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) one (1) Share for every one (1) Share subject to Options or Stock Appreciation Rights granted under the Plan or options or stock appreciation rights granted under any Prior Plan, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) as 3.0 Shares for every one (1) Share subject to Awards other than Options or Stock Appreciation Rights granted under the Plan or awards other than options or stock appreciation rights granted under any Prior Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.2    Code Section 162(m) and 422 Limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate number of Shares subject to Stock Options or Stock Appreciation Rights granted under this Plan during any calendar year to any one Eligible Participant shall not exceed 1,125,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate number of Shares issuable with respect to any Restricted Stock Awards, Incentive Awards denominated in Shares or Stock Unit Awards (other than Shares issued or issuable upon exercise of Stock Options or Stock Appreciation Rights) granted under this Plan during any calendar year to any one Eligible Participant shall not exceed 375,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum amount payable pursuant to that portion of an Incentive Award granted under this Plan for any fiscal year to any Participant that is intended to satisfy the requirements for "performance based compensation" under Code Section 162(m) and is denominated in cash shall not exceed Ten Million Dollars ($10,000,000).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the Plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the foregoing limitations shall be subject to adjustment under Section 13 only to the extent that such adjustment will not affect the status of any Award intended to qualify as "performance based compensation" under Code Section 162(m) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) with respect to awards to newly-hired employees in connection with the commencement of their employment, the limits shall be two times the amounts set forth in this Section 3.2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate number of Shares that may be issued pursuant to the exercise of ISOs (as defined below) granted under this Plan shall not exceed 12,200,000, which number shall be calculated and adjusted pursuant to Section 13 only to the extent that such calculation or adjustment will not affect the status of any option intended to qualify as an incentive stock option under Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.3    Substitute Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Substitute Awards shall not reduce the Shares authorized for issuance under the Plan or authorized for grant to an Eligible Participant in any calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, in the event that a company acquired by the Company or any subsidiary, or with which the Company or any subsidiary combines, has shares available under a pre-existing plan approved by stockholders and not adopted in contemplation of such acquisition or combination, the shares available for grant pursuant to the terms of such pre-existing plan (as adjusted, to the extent appropriate, using the exchange ratio or other adjustment or valuation ratio or formula used in such acquisition or combination to determine the consideration payable to the holders of common stock of the entities party to such acquisition or combination) may be used for Awards under the Plan and shall not reduce the Shares authorized for issuance under the Plan; provided that Awards using such available shares shall not be made after the date awards or grants could have been made under the terms of the pre-existing plan, absent the acquisition or combination, and shall only be made to individuals who were employees or directors of such acquired or combined company before such acquisition or combination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this Section 3.3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "Substitute Awards" means Awards granted or Shares issued by the Company in assumption of, or in substitution or exchange for, awards previously granted, or the right or obligation to make future awards, by a company acquired by the Company or any subsidiary or with which the Company or any subsidiary combines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.4    Awards to Non-Employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to adjustment pursuant to the provisions of Section 13 hereof, the aggregate dollar value of Shares subject to Awards granted under this Plan, together with any cash compensation earned and paid or payable, for services rendered during any calendar year to any one Eligible Director shall not exceed $600,000; provided, however, that in the calendar year in which an Eligible Director first joins the Board or is first designated as Chairman of the Board or Lead Director, such maximum dollar value may be up to two hundred percent (200%) of the dollar value set forth in the foregoing limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, any cash compensation that is deferred under the Fluor Corporation 409A Deferred Directors' Fees Program or otherwise shall be counted towards the foregoing limit for the year in which the compensation is earned (and not counted in the year it is paid/settled), and no interest or other earnings on such compensation shall count towards the limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Persons Eligible Under Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any person who is
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) an employee of the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a prospective employee of the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a director of the Company who is not an employee of the Company or any of its subsidiaries (an "Eligible Director"),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) a consultant to the Company, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) an advisor of the Company (each, an "Eligible Participant") shall be eligible to be considered for the grant of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this Plan, the Chairman of the Board's status as an employee shall be determined by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A "Participant" is any Eligible Participant to whom an Award has been made and any person (including any estate) to whom an Award has been assigned or transferred pursuant to Section 11.1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.1    Award Types.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, on behalf of the Company, is authorized under this Plan to enter into certain types of arrangements with Eligible Participants and to confer certain benefits to them ("Awards").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following types of Awards are authorized under the Plan if granted according to the terms and conditions of the Plan: Stock Option (including incentive stock options), Stock Appreciation Right, Restricted Stock, Incentive and Stock Unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These authorized types of Awards are defined as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Option Award:    A Stock Option is a right granted under Section 6 of this Plan to purchase a specified number of Shares at a specified exercise price, at such times, and on such other terms and conditions as are specified in or determined pursuant to the document(s) evidencing the Award (the "Option Agreement").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options intended to qualify as incentive stock options ("ISOs") pursuant to Code Section 422 and Stock Options that are not intended to qualify as ISOs ("Non-Qualified Stock Options" or "NQSOs") may be granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Right Award:    A Stock Appreciation Right is a right granted pursuant to Section 7 of this Plan that entitles the Participant to receive, in cash or Shares or a combination thereof, as determined by the Committee, value equal to or otherwise based on the excess of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the fair market value of a specified number of Shares at the time of exercise over
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the exercise price of the right, as established by the Committee on the date of grant, and on such other terms and conditions as are specified in or determined pursuant to the document(s) evidencing the Award (the "Stock Appreciation Right Agreement").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Award:    A Restricted Stock Award is an award of Shares made under Section 8 of this Plan, the grant, issuance, retention and/or vesting of which is subject to such performance and/or other conditions as are expressed in the document(s) evidencing the Award (the "Restricted Stock Agreement").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive Award:    An Incentive Award is a bonus opportunity awarded under Section 9 of this Plan pursuant to which a Participant may become entitled to receive an amount payable either in cash, Shares or other property based on satisfaction of such performance and/or service criteria as are specified in the document(s) evidencing the Award (the "Incentive Bonus Agreement").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Unit Award:    A Stock Unit Award is an award of a right to receive the fair market value of a specified number of Shares made under Section 10 of this Plan, the grant, issuance price, retention and/or vesting of which is subject to such performance and/or other conditions as are expressed in the document(s) evidencing the Award (the "Stock Unit Agreement").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.2    Grants of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An Award may consist of one or two or more Award types made in any combination or in the alternative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 6.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Option Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may grant a Stock Option or provide for the grant of a Stock Option, in the discretion of the Committee or automatically upon the occurrence of specified events previously
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: established by the Committee including, without limitation, the achievement of performance goals, the satisfaction of an event or condition within the control of the recipient of the Award, within the control of others or not within any person's control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.1    Option Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Option Agreement shall contain provisions regarding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the number of Shares which may be issued upon exercise of the Stock Option,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the purchase price of the Shares and the means of payment for the Shares,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the term of the Stock Option,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) such terms and conditions of exercisability as may be determined by the Committee,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) any restrictions on the transfer of the Stock Option,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) forfeiture provisions, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) such further terms and conditions, consistent with the Plan as may be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Option Agreements evidencing ISOs shall contain such terms and conditions as may be necessary to comply with the applicable provisions of Code Section 422.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.2    Stock Option Price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purchase price per Share of the Shares subject to each Stock Option granted under the Plan shall equal or exceed 100% of the fair market value of such Stock on the date the Stock Option is granted, except that the Committee may specifically provide that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) to the extent consistent with Section 409A of the Code, "fair market value", solely for purposes of determining the purchase price per share for Stock Options, may be determined using an average selling or closing price of the Shares during a specified period that is within 30 days before through 30 days after the date the Stock Option is granted and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the exercise price of a Stock Option may be higher or ower in the case of a Stock Option granted to employees or directors of a company acquired by the Company in assumption and substitution of options held by such employees or directors at the time such company is acquired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assumption and substitution of options shall not result in discounted options subject to Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.3    Stock Option Term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The "term" of each Stock Option granted under the Plan, including any ISOs, shall be stated in the Option Agreement but may not exceed ten 10) years from the date of its grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event that on the last business day of the term of a Stock Option
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the exercise of the Stock Option, other than an ISO, is prohibited by applicable law or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Shares may not be purchased or sold by the applicable Eligible Participant due to the "black-out period" of a Company policy or a "lock-up" agreement undertaken in connection with an issuance of securities by the Company, the term shall be extended for a period of 30 days following the end of he legal prohibition, black-out period or lock-up agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.4    Stock Option Vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options granted under the Plan shall be exercisable at such time and in such manner prior to the expiration of the Stock Option's term as etermined in the sole discretion of the Committee and evidenced in the terms of the Option Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have the right to make the timing of the ability to xercise any Stock Option granted under the Plan subject to such performance requirements as deemed appropriate by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At any time after the grant of a Stock Option, the Committee may, in its sole discretion, reduce or eliminate any restrictions surrounding any Participant's right to exercise all or part of the Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.5    Option Exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)    Partial Exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An exercisable Stock Option may be exercised in whole or in part.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, a Stock Option shall not be exercisable with respect to fractional Shares and the Committee may require, by the terms of the Option Agreement, that any partial exercise must be for a minimum number of whole Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)    Manner of Exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An exercisable Stock Option shall be deemed exercised (in whole or in part) only upon delivery to the Company representative designated by the Committee all of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a notice of exercise (in such form as the Committee authorizes) specifying the number of Shares to be purchased b the Participant;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) payment or provision for payment of the exercise price (in compliance with Section 6.5(c) hereof) for such number of Shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) such
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: representations and documents as the Committee, in its sole discretion, deems necessary or advisable to effect compliance with all applicable provisions of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and any other Federal, state or foreign securities laws or regulations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) in the event that the Stock Option shall be exercised pursuant to Section 11.1 by any person or persons other than the Participant, appropriate proof of the right of such person or persons to exercise the Option; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) such representations and documents as the Committee, in its sole discretion, deems necessary or advisable to provide for tax withholding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
