sentences.text: Unless provided otherwise by the Committee, no Participant shall have any right as a stockholder with respect to any Shares purchased pursuant to any Stock Option until the registration of Shares in the name of the Participant, and no adjustment shall be made for dividends (ordinary or extraordinary, whether in cash, securities or other property) or distributions or other rights for which the record date is prior to the date such Shares are so registered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c)    Payment of Exercise Price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent authorized by the Committee, the exercise price of a Stock Option may be paid at the time established by the terms of the Option Agreement or at the time of exercise of the Stock Option in one or more of the following methods:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) cash or certified or cashiers' check;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) shares of Company capital stock that have been held by the Participant for such period of time as the Committee may specify;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) other property deemed acceptable by the Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) a reduction in the number of Shares or other property otherwise issuable pursuant to such Stock Option;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) a broker-assisted cashless exercise program established by the Company or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) any combination of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) through
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.6    ISO Limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ISOs may be granted only to Eligible Participants who are employees of the Company (or of any subsidiary corporation (within the meaning of ection 424 of the Code) of the Company or any joint venture operation or joint venture partner of the Company or its subsidiaries) on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate fair market value (determined as of the date the ISO is granted) of the Shares with respect to which ISOs are exercisable for the first time by any Participant during any calendar year under all plans of the Company (or of any parent or subsidiary corporation (within the meaning of Section 424 of the Code) of the Company)) shall not exceed $100,000 or such ther amount as may subsequently be specified by the Code and/or applicable regulations; provided that if such limitation is exceeded, any Stock Options on Shares in excess of uch limitation shall be deemed to be NQSOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All ISOs must be granted within ten years from the date the Plan was last approved by the Company's stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of n ISO granted to an Eligible Participant who, at the time of the grant, owns stock representing more than 10% of the voting power of all classes of stock of the Company or any ubsidiary, then: the exercise price per share shall be no less than 110% of the fair market value of one Share on the date of grant; and the term of the ISO shall not exceed five ears from the date the ISO is granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ISOs shall contain such other provisions as the Committee shall deem advisable but shall in all events be consistent with and contain or be eemed to contain all provisions required in order to qualify as incentive stock options under Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.7    No Repricing without Stockholder Approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than in connection with a change in the Company's capitalization (as described in Section 13) the exercise price f an outstanding Stock Option may not be reduced after the date of grant nor may any outstanding Stock Option with an exercise price in excess of fair market value be urrendered to the Company (via cancellation and re-grant or exchange) as consideration for cash, the grant of a new Stock Option with a lower (or no) exercise price or the grant f another Award without stockholder approval; provided, however, that in the event of a Change of Control, any outstanding Stock Option with an exercise price equal to or in xcess of the value of the consideration to be paid to the holders of Shares (on a per share basis) may be cancelled without any consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 7.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Right Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights may be granted to Participants from time to time either in tandem with or as a component of other Awards granted under the Plan ("tandem Stock Appreciation Rights") or not in conjunction with other Awards ("freestanding Stock Appreciation Rights") and may, but need not, relate to a specific Stock Option granted under Section 6.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The provisions of Stock Appreciation Rights need not be the same with respect to each grant or each recipient.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Stock Appreciation Right granted in tandem with an Award may be granted at the same time such Award is granted or at any time thereafter before exercise or expiration of such Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All freestanding Stock Appreciation Rights shall be granted subject to the same terms and conditions applicable to Stock Options as set forth in Section 6 and all tandem Stock Appreciation Rights shall have the same exercise price, vesting, exercisability, forfeiture and termination provisions as the Award to which they relate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the provisions of Section 6 and the immediately preceding sentence, the Committee may impose such other conditions or restrictions on any Stock Appreciation Right as it shall deem appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights may be settled in Shares, cash or a combination thereof, as determined by the Committee and set forth in the applicable award agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than in connection with a change in the Company's capitalization (as described in Section 13) the exercise price of Stock Appreciation Rights may not be reduced after the date of grant nor may any outstanding Stock Appreciation Right with an exercise price in excess of fair market value be surrendered to the Company (via cancellation and re-grant or exchange) as consideration for cash, the grant of a new Stock Appreciation Right with a lower exercise price or the grant of another Award without stockholder approval; provided, however, that in the event of a Change of Control, any outstanding Stock Appreciation Right with an exercise price equal to or in excess of the value of the consideration to be paid to the holders of Shares (on a per share basis) may be cancelled without any consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 8.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock consists of an award of Shares, the grant, issuance, retention and/or vesting of which shall be subject to such performance conditions and/or to such further terms and conditions as the Committee deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.1    Restricted Stock Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Restricted Stock Award shall reflect, to the extent applicable
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the number of Shares subject to such Award or a formula for determining such,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the time or times at which Shares shall be granted or issued and/or become retainable or vested, and the conditions or restrictions on such Shares,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the performance criteria and required level of achievement relative to these criteria which shall determine the number of Shares granted, issued, retainable and/or vested,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) the measuring period for determining achievement of performance,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) forfeiture provisions, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) such further terms and conditions consistent with the Plan as may be determined from time to time by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.2    Performance and Other Criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant, issuance, retention and/or vesting of each Restricted Stock Award may be subject to such performance and other criteria and required level of achievement relative to these criteria as the Committee shall determine, which criteria may be based on business performance, personal performance evaluations and/or completion of a specified period of service by the Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the performance criteria for any Restricted Stock Award that is intended by the Committee to satisfy the requirements for "performance-based compensation" under Code Section 162(m) shall be a measure based solely on one or more Qualifying Performance Criteria (as defined in Section 11.2 hereof) selected by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.3    Timing of Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall determine all specifics concerning the timing of any Restricted Stock Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.4    Discretionary Adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding satisfaction of any required period of service or performance goals, the number of Shares granted, issued, retainable and/or vested under a Restricted Stock Award based on either business performance or personal performance evaluations may be reduced (or, with respect to awards not intended to qualify as "performance-based compensation" under Section 162(m) of the Code, increased) by the Committee on the basis of such further considerations as the Committee in its sole discretion shall determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 9.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Incentive Award will confer upon the Eligible Participant the opportunity to earn a future payment tied to a specified level of achievement with respect to performance and/or service criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.1    Incentive Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Incentive Award shall contain provisions regarding, as applicable
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the target and maximum amount payable to the Participant as an Incentive Award,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the performance and/or service criteria and required level of achievement, as applicable, relative to these criteria which shall determine the amount of such payment,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the period as to which performance shall be measured for establishing the amount of any payment,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) the vesting of the Incentive Award,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) restrictions on the alienation or transfer of the Incentive Award prior to actual payment,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) forfeiture provisions, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) such further terms and conditions, consistent with the Plan as may be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In establishing the provisions of Incentive Awards, the Committee may refer to categories of such Awards as parts of "Programs" or "Plans", which names will not affect the applicability of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.2    Performance Criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If applicable, the Committee shall establish the performance criteria and required level of achievement relative to these criteria which shall determine the target, minimum and maximum amount payable under an Incentive Award, which criteria may be based on business performance and/or personal performance evaluations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may specify the amount or percentage of the target Incentive Award that is intended to satisfy the requirements for "performance-based compensation" under Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the performance criteria for any portion of an Incentive Award that is intended by the Committee to satisfy the requirements for "performance-based compensation" under Code Section 162(m) shall be a measure based solely on one or more Qualifying Performance Criteria (as defined in Section 11.2 hereof) selected by the Committee and specified at the time required under Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.3    Timing and Form of Payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may permit a Participant or the Company to elect for the payment of any Incentive Award to be deferred to a specified date or event in accordance with an election made pursuant to the Fluor Executive 409A Deferred Compensation Program (or any successor thereto).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may specify the form of payment of Incentive Awards, which may be cash, shares, or other property.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.4    Discretionary Adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding satisfaction of any performance goals, the amount paid under an Incentive Award based on either business performance or personal performance evaluations may be reduced (or, with respect to awards not intended to qualify as "performance-based compensation" under Section 162(m) of the Code, increased) by the Committee on the basis of such further considerations as the Committee in its sole discretion shall determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 10.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10.1    Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A "Stock Unit" is a bookkeeping entry representing an amount equivalent to the fair market value of one Share, also sometimes referred to as a "restricted unit" or "shadow stock".
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Units represent an unfunded and unsecured obligation of the Company, except as otherwise provided for by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10.2    Stock Unit Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Stock Unit Award shall reflect, to the extent applicable
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the number of Stock Units subject to such Award or a formula for determining such,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the time or times at which Stock Units shall be granted and/or become vested, and the conditions or restrictions on such Stock Units,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the performance and/or service criteria and required level of achievement, as applicable, relative to these criteria which shall determine the number of Stock Units granted, issued, retainable and/or vested,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) the measuring period for determining achievement of performance,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) forfeiture provisions, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) such further terms and conditions, in each case not inconsistent with the Plan as may be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10.3    Performance and Other Criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant, issuance, retention and or vesting of each Stock Unit may be subject to such performance and other criteria and required level of achievement relative to these criteria as the Committee shall determine, which criteria may be based on business performance, personal performance evaluations and/or completion of a specified period of service by the Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the performance criteria for any Stock Unit that is intended by the Committee to satisfy the requirements for "performance- based compensation" under Code Section 162(m) shall be a measure based solely on one or more Qualifying Performance Criteria (as defined in Section 11.2 hereof) selected by the Committee and specified at the time the Stock Unit is granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10.4    Timing of Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall determine all specifics concerning the timing of any Stock Unit Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10.5    Settlement of Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may provide for Stock Units to be settled in cash and/or Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may permit a Participant or the Company to elect for the settlement of any Stock Unit Award to be deferred to a specified date or event in accordance with an election made pursuant to the Fluor Executive 409A Deferred Compensation Program or the Fluor Corporation 409A Deferred Directors' Fees Program (or any successor thereto), as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of cash or Shares, to be distributed may, if the Stock Unit Agreement provides, be increased by an interest factor or by dividend equivalents, as the case may be, which may be valued as if reinvested in Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until a Stock Unit is settled, the number of Shares represented by a Stock Unit shall be subject to adjustment pursuant to Section 13.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10.6    Discretionary Adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding satisfaction of any required period of service or performance goals, the number of Stock Units granted, issued, retainable and/or vested under a Stock Unit Award due to business performance or personal performance evaluations may be reduced (or, with respect to awards not intended to qualify as "performance-based compensation" under Section 162(m) of the Code, increased) by the Committee on the basis of such further considerations as the Committee in its sole discretion shall determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 11.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Provisions Applicable to Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11.1    Transferability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the agreement evidencing an Award (or an amendment thereto authorized by the Committee) expressly states that it is transferable as provided hereunder, no Award granted under the Plan, nor any interest in such Award, may be sold, assigned, conveyed, gifted, pledged, hypothecated or otherwise transferred in any manner, other than by will or the laws of descent and distribution, prior to the vesting or lapse of any and all restrictions applicable to an Award or any Shares issued under an Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During a Participant's lifetime, Stock Options and Stock Appreciation Rights may only be exercised by the Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may in its sole discretion grant an Award or amend an outstanding Award to provide that the Award is transferable or assignable to a member or members of the Participant's "immediate family", as such term is defined under Rule 16a-1(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), or to a trust for the benefit solely of a member or members
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of the Participant's immediate family, or to a partnership or other entity whose only owners are members of the Participant's family, provided that following any such transfer or assignment the Award will remain subject to substantially the same terms applicable to the Award while held by the Participant, as modified as the Committee in its sole discretion shall determine appropriate, and the Participant shall execute an agreement agreeing to be bound by such terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11.2    Qualifying Performance Criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this Plan, the term "Qualifying Performance Criteria" shall mean any one or more of the following performance criteria, or derivations of such performance criteria, either individually, alternatively or in any combination, applied to either the Company as a whole or to a business unit, subsidiary or business segment, either individually, alternatively or in any combination, and measured over a performance period to be determined by the Committee, on an absolute basis or relative to a pre-established target, to previous years' results or to a designated comparison group, either based on United States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ("GAAP") or non-GAAP financial results, in each case as specified by the Committee in the Award:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) cash flow (including operating cash flow or free cash flow);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) earnings (including gross margin, earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization ("EBITDA"), earnings before interest and taxes ("EBIT"), earnings before taxes ("EBT"), and net earnings);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) earnings per share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) stock price;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) return on equity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) total stockholder return;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) return on capital or return on invested capital (ROIC);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) return on assets or net assets or return on assets employed (ROAE);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) return on investment;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (j) revenue;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k) income or net income;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l) operating income or net operating income;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (m) operating profit or net operating profit;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (n) segment profit or segment profit margin;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (o) operating margin;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (p) return on operating revenue;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (q) market share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (r) contract awards or backlog;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (s) remaining unsatisfied performance obligations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (t) overhead or other expense reduction or cost savings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (u) credit rating;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) strategic plan development and implementation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (w) succession plan development and implementation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) retention of executive talent;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (y) workforce diversity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (z) return on average stockholders' equity relative to the Ten Year Treasury Yield (as hereinafter defined) or any similar, independent benchmark; (aa) safety records; (bb) corporate tax savings; (cc) corporate cost of capital reduction; (dd) capital resource management plan development and implementation; (ee) internal financial controls plan development and implementation; (ff) investor relations program development and implementation; (gg) corporate relations program development and implementation; (hh) executive performance plan development and implementation; (ii) tax provision rate for financial statement purposes; (jj) cash flow return on investment (CFROI); (kk) warranted equity value (WEV); (ll) project gross margin (PGM) in earnings and in contract awards; (mm) project gross margin percentage in earnings and contract awards; (nn) project working capital; (oo) cost of cash; (pp) overhead leverage; (qq) ratio of earnings to fixed charges; and (rr) debt as a percentage of total capitalization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent provided for by the Committee at the time an Award is granted or otherwise as permitted under Code Section 162(m), the Committee shall appropriately adjust any evaluation of performance under a Qualifying Performance Criteria to account for any of the following events that occurs during a performance period:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) asset write- downs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) litigation or claim judgments or settlements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the effect of changes in tax law, accounting principles or other such laws or provisions affecting reported results;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) accruals for reorganization and restructuring programs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) any infrequently occurring or other unusual items, either under applicable accounting provisions or in management's discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations appearing in the Company's annual report to stockholders for the applicable year; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) any other events as the Committee shall deem appropriate, if such adjustment is timely approved in connection with the establishment of Qualifying Performance Criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term "Ten Year Treasury Yield" shall mean, for any fiscal period, the daily average percent per annum yield for U.S. Government Securities  10 year Treasury constant maturities, as published in the Federal Reserve statistical release or any equivalent publication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the payment of any Award intended to qualify as "performance-based compensation" under Code Section 162(m) the Committee shall certify the extent to which any Qualifying Performance Criteria and any other material terms under such Award have been satisfied (other than in cases where the criteria relate solely to the increase in the value of the Company's Common Stock).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to any Award that is intended to satisfy the conditions for "performance-based compensation" under Code Section 162(m): (a) the Committee shall interpret the Plan in light of Code Section 162(m) and the regulations thereunder; and (b) such Award shall not be paid until the Committee shall first have certified that the Qualifying Performance Criteria have been satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11.3    Dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall specify whether dividends or dividend equivalent amounts shall be credited and/or payable to any Participant with respect to the Shares subject to an Award; provided, however, that in no event will dividends or dividend equivalents be paid in respect of Stock Options or Stock Appreciation Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, dividends or dividend equivalents credited/payable in connection with an Award that is not yet vested shall be subject to the same restrictions and risk of forfeiture as the underlying Award and shall not be paid until the underlying Award vests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11.4    Voting Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the vesting of the Shares underlying a Restricted Stock Award, Participants who hold a Restricted Stock Award shall have the right to vote such underlying Shares as the record owners thereof, and Participants who hold Stock Units shall not have voting rights with respect to the underlying Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11.5    Agreements Evidencing Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall, subject to applicable law, determine the date an Award is deemed to be granted, which for purposes of this Plan shall not be affected by the fact that an Award is contingent on subsequent stockholder approval of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee or its delegate(s), except to the extent prohibited under applicable law, may establish the terms of agreements evidencing Awards under this Plan and may, but need not, require as a condition to any such agreement's effectiveness that such agreement be executed by the Participant and that the Participant agree to such further terms and conditions as specified in the agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of an Award under this Plan shall not confer any rights upon the Participant holding such Award other than such terms, and subject to such conditions, as are specified in this Plan as being applicable to such type of Award (or to all Awards) or as are expressly set forth in the agreement evidencing such Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11.6    Tandem Stock or Cash Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Either at the time an Award is granted or by subsequent action, the Committee may, but need not, provide that an Award shall contain as a provision thereof, a right, either in tandem with the other rights under the Award or as an alternative thereto, of the Participant to receive, without payment to the Company, a number of Shares, cash or a combination thereof, the amount of which is determined by reference to the value of the Award; provided, however, that the number of such rights granted under any Award shall not exceed the per Eligible Participant share limitation for such Award as set forth in Section 3.2 or Section 3.4, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 12.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Payments and No Deferral of Stock Option or SAR Gains.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms and conditions of the Plan, the Committee may determine that all or a portion of any Award to a Participant, whether it is to be paid in cash, Shares or a combination thereof, shall be deferred or may, in its sole discretion, approve deferral elections made by Participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferrals shall be for such periods and upon such terms as the Committee may determine in its sole discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, deferral of Stock Option or SAR gains shall not be permitted under the Plan, and in no event will any deferral of the delivery of Shares or any other payment with respect to any Award be allowed if the Committee determines, in its sole discretion, that the deferral would result in the imposition of the additional tax under Section 409A(a)(1)(B) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Award shall provide for deferral of compensation that does not comply with Section 409A of the Code, unless the Committee, at the time of grant, specifically provides that the Award is not
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: intended to comply with Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall have no liability to a Participant, or any other party, if an Award that is intended to be exempt from, or compliant with, Section 409A of the Code is not so exempt or compliant or for any action taken by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Should any payments made in accordance with the Plan to a Specified Employee (as defined for purposes of Section 409A of the Code) be determined to be payments from a nonqualified deferred compensation plan, as defined by Section 409A of the Code and are payable in connection with a Participant's Separation from Service, that are not exempt from Section 409A of the Code as a short-term deferral or otherwise, these payments, to the extent otherwise payable within six (6) months after the Participant's date of Separation from Service, and to the extent necessary to avoid the imposition of taxes under Section 409A of the Code, will be paid in a lump sum on the earlier of the date that is six (6) months after the Participant's date of Separation from Service or the date of the Participant's death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the Plan, a "Separation from Service" means an anticipated permanent reduction in a Participant's level of bona fide services to twenty percent (20%) or less of the average level of bona fide services performed by a Participant over the immediately preceding thirty-six (36) month period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of Section 409A of the Code, the payments to be made to a Participant in accordance with this Plan shall be treated as a right to a series of separate payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 13.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in Capital Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the outstanding securities of the class then subject to this Plan are increased, decreased or exchanged for or converted into cash, property or a different number or kind of shares or securities, or if cash, property or shares or securities are distributed in respect of such outstanding securities, in either case as a result of a reorganization, merger, consolidation, recapitalization, restructuring, reclassification, dividend (other than a regular, quarterly cash dividend) or other distribution, stock split, reverse stock split, spin-off or the like, or if substantially all of the property and assets of the Company are sold, then, the Committee shall make appropriate and proportionate adjustments in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the number and type of shares or other securities or cash or other property that may be acquired pursuant to outstanding Awards under this Plan and the exercise or settlement price of such Awards, as well as the limits with respect to Awards set forth in Section 3.2 and Section 3.4 of the Plan; provided, however, that any such adjustment shall be made in such a manner that will not affect the status of any Award intended to qualify (A) as an ISO under Code Section 422, (B) as exempt from coverage under Code Section 409A, or (C) as "performance based compensation" under Code Section 162(m), and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the maximum number and type of shares or other securities that may be issued pursuant to such Awards thereafter granted under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 14.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change of Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 14.1    Effect of Change of Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may through the terms of the Award or otherwise provide that any or all of the following shall occur, either mmediately upon the Change of Control, or upon termination of the Eligible Participant's employment or service within twenty-four (24) months following a Change of Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) in the case of an Option, the Participant's ability to exercise any portion of the Option not previously exercisable;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) in the case of an Incentive Award payable in cash, the right to receive a payment equal to the target amount payable or a payment based on performance (or amounts accrued) through a date determined by the Committee prior to the Change of Control; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) in the case of Shares issued in payment of any Incentive Award, and/or in the case of Restricted Stock or Stock Units, the lapse and expiration of any conditions to the grant, issuance, retention, vesting or transferability of, or any other restrictions applicable to, such Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, in connection with a Change of Control, no provision is made for the exercise, payment or lapse of conditions or restrictions on the Award, or other procedure whereby the Participant may realize the full benefit of the Award, the Committee may, through the terms of the Award or otherwise, provide for a conditional exercise, payment or lapse of conditions or restrictions on an Award, which shall only be effective if such Change of Control is consummated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in no event shall any accelerated vesting of an Award in connection with a Change of Control be effective unless the Change of Control is consummated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 14.2    Definitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the Committee or the Board shall provide otherwise, "Change of Control" shall mean an occurrence of any of the following events: (a) a third person, including a "group" as defined in Section 13
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)(3) of the Exchange Act, acquires shares of the Company having twenty-five percent or more of the total number of votes that may be cast for the election of directors of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the persons who were directors of the Company on the effective date of this Plan (the "Incumbent Directors") shall cease to constitute a majority of the Board of Directors of the Company or any successor to the Company, provided that any person becoming a director of the Company subsequent to the effective date of this Plan shall be considered an Incumbent Director if such person's election or nomination for election was approved by a vote of at least 50 percent of the Incumbent Directors; but provided further, that any such person whose initial assumption of office is in connection with an actual or threatened proxy contest relating to the election of members of the Board of Directors of the Company or other actual or threatened solicitation of proxies or consents by or on behalf of a person other than the Board of the Company, including by reason of agreement intended to avoid or settle any such actual or threatened contest or solicitation, shall not be considered an Incumbent Director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the consummation of a transaction pursuant to which the Company will have merged into or consolidated with another corporation, or merged another corporation into the Company, on a basis whereby less than fifty percent (50%) of the total voting power of the surviving corporation is represented by shares held by stockholders of the Company immediately prior to such merger or consolidation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) the consummation of a sale or disposition by the Company of all or substantially all of the Company's assets, other than a sale or disposition if the holders of the voting securities of the Company outstanding immediately prior thereto hold securities immediately thereafter which represent more than a majority of the combined voting power of the voting securities of the acquirer, or parent of the acquirer, of such assets; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) approval by the stockholders of the Company of the liquidation or dissolution of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 15.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Recoupment Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms and conditions of the Plan, the Committee may provide that any Participant and/or any Award, including any Shares subject to an Award, is subject to any recovery, recoupment, clawback and/or other forfeiture policy maintained by the Company from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, this provision also applies to any policy adopted by any exchange on which the securities of the Company are listed pursuant to Section 10D of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent any such policy requires the repayment of incentive-based compensation received by a Participant, whether paid pursuant to an Award granted under this Plan or any other plan of incentive-based compensation maintained in the past or adopted in the future by the Company, by accepting an Award under this Plan, the Participant agrees to the repayment of such amounts to the extent required by such policy and applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 16.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taxes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 16.1    Withholding Requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may make such provisions or impose such conditions as it may deem appropriate for the withholding or payment by the Eligible Participant or Participant, as appropriate, for any taxes required as a result of any Awards granted under this Plan, and a Participant's rights in any Award are subject to satisfaction of such requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 16.2    Payment of Withholding Taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the terms of Section 16.1 hereof, the Committee may provide in the agreement evidencing an Award or otherwise that all or any portion of the required withholding for taxes by the Company or, if permitted by the Committee, desired to be withheld by the Participant, in connection with the exercise of a Stock Option or Stock Appreciation Right or the exercise, vesting, settlement or transfer of any other Award shall be paid or, at the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: election of the Participant, may be paid by the Company with cash or shares of the Company's capital stock otherwise issuable or subject to such Award, or by the Participant delivering previously owned shares of the Company's capital stock, in each case having a fair market value equal to the minimum amount required to be withheld.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such elections are subject to such conditions or procedures as may be established by the Committee and are subject to Committee approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 17.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective Date, Amendments and Termination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 17.1    Effectiveness and Expiration of Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan was adopted by the Board on February 1, 2017 and will become effective when it is approved by the Company's stockholders (the "Effective Date").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Stock Option Award, Stock Appreciation Right Award, Restricted Stock Award, Incentive Award or Stock Unit Award shall be granted pursuant to the Plan more than ten (10) years after the Effective Date; provided, however, no Option intended to qualify as an incentive stock option under Section 422 of the Code shall be granted pursuant to the Plan after February 1, 2027.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 17.2    Amendment and Termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors may amend, alter or discontinue the Plan or any agreement evidencing an Award made under the Plan, but an such amendment shall be subject to approval of the stockholders of the Company to the extent required by law or by any applicable listing standard of the New York Stock Exchange or other securities exchange or stock market where the Company has listed the Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, unless approved by a majority of the stockholders of the Company present in person or by proxy and actually voting, no such amendment shall be made that would:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)   materially increase the maximum number of Shares for which Awards may be granted under the Plan, other than an increase pursuant to Section 13 ("Changes in Capital Structure");
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)   reduce the price at which Stock Options or Stock Appreciation Rights may be granted, as described in Section 6.2;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: c)   reduce the exercise price of outstanding Stock Options or Stock Appreciation Rights, as described in Section 6.7 and Section 7
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)   extend the term of the Plan; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e)   change the class of persons eligible to be Participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the date of a Change of Control, no amendment to the Plan or any agreement evidencing an Award made under the Plan shall be effected that impairs the rights of any Award holder, without such holder's consent, under any Award granted prior to the date of the Change of Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 18.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with Other Laws and Regulations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan, the grant and exercise of Awards hereunder, and the obligation of the Company to sell, issue or deliver Shares under such Awards, shall be subject to all applicable Federal, state and foreign laws, rules and regulations and to such approvals by any governmental or regulatory agency as may be required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall not be required to register in a Participant's name or deliver any Shares prior to the completion of any registration or qualification of such Shares under any Federal, state or foreign law or any ruling or regulation of any government body which the Committee shall, in its sole discretion, determine to be necessary or advisable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Plan is intended to constitute an unfunded arrangement for a select group of management or other key personnel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Stock Option or Stock Appreciation Right shall be exercisable unless a registration statement with respect to the Stock Option or Stock Appreciation Right has been made and is in effect or the Company has determined that such registration is unnecessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the Awards and Shares covered by this Plan have been registered under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Company has determined that such registration is unnecessary, each person receiving an Award and/or Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: pursuant to any Award may be required by the Company to give a representation in writing that such person is acquiring such Shares for his or her own account for investment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 19.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award Grants by Subsidiaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of a grant of an Award to any Participant employed by or providing service to a subsidiary or affiliate, such grant may, if the Committee so directs, be implemented by the Company issuing any subject Shares to the subsidiary or affiliate, for such lawful consideration as the Committee may determine, upon the condition or understanding that the subsidiary or affiliate will transfer the Shares to the Participant in accordance with the terms of the Award specified by the Committee pursuant to the provisions of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding any other provision hereof, such Award may be issued by and in the name of the subsidiary or affiliate and shall be deemed granted on such date as the Committee shall determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 20.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Miscellaneous
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.1    Rights as Stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as otherwise provided herein, a Participant shall have no rights as a holder of Shares with respect to Awards hereunder, unless and until the Participant becomes registered as a holder of Shares on the records of the Company and/or any transfer agent or other administrator designated by the Company from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.2    No Right to Company Employment or Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nothing in this Plan or as a result of any Award granted pursuant to this Plan shall confer on any individual any right to continue in the employ or service of the Company or interfere in any way with the right of the Company to terminate an individual's employment or service at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Award agreements may contain such provisions as the Committee may approve with reference to the effect of approved leaves of absence by the Participant receiving the Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.3    Funding of Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan is intended to be an unfunded plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall not be required to establish or fund any special or separate account or to make any other segregation of assets to assure the payment of any Award under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are and shall at all times be general creditors of the Company with respect to thei Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Committee or the Company chooses to set aside funds in a trust or otherwise for the payment of Awards under the Plan, such funds shall at all times be subject to he claims of the creditors of the Company in the event of its bankruptcy or insolvency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.4    Successors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All obligations of the Company under the Plan with respect to Awards granted hereunder shall be binding on any successor to the Company, whether the existence of such successor is the result of a direct or indirect purchase, merger, consolidation, or otherwise, of all or substantially all of the business and/or assets of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.5    Gender and Number.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except where otherwise indicated by the context, any masculine term used herein also shall include the feminine, any feminine term used herein shall include the masculine, and the plural shall include the singular and the singular shall include the plural.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.6    Severability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any provision of the Plan shall be held illegal or invalid for any reason, such illegality or invalidity shall not affect the remaining parts of the Plan, and the Plan shall be construed and enforced as if the illegal or invalid provision had not been included.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.7    Rules of Construction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whenever any provision of the Plan refers to any law, rule, or regulation, such provision shall be deemed to refer to the law, rule, or regulation currently in effect and, when and if such law, rule, or regulation is subsequently amended or replaced, to the amended or successor law, rule, or regulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term "including" shall be deemed to include the words "including without limitation."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.8    No Liability of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company and any subsidiary or affiliate which is in existence or hereafter comes into existence shall not be liable to a Participant or any other person as to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the non-issuance or sale of shares of Common Stock as to which the Company has been unable to obtain from any regulatory body having jurisdiction the authority deemed by the Company's counsel to be necessary to the lawful issuance and sale of any shares of Common Stock hereunder; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any tax consequence expected, but not realized, by any Participant or other person due to the receipt, exercise or settlement of any Award granted hereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.9    Non-Exclusivity of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither the adoption of the Plan by the Board of Directors nor the submission of the Plan to the stockholders of the Company for approval shall be construed as creating any limitations on the power of the Board of Directors or the Committee to adopt such other incentive arrangements as it or they may deem desirable, including without limitation, the granting of restricted stock or stock options otherwise than under the Plan, and such arrangements may be either generally applicable or applicable only in specific cases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.10    Governing Law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Plan and any agreements hereunder shall be interpreted and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware and applicable Federal law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may provide that any dispute as to any Award shall be presented and determined in such forum as the Committee may specify, including through binding arbitration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any reference in this Plan or in the agreement evidencing any Award to a provision of law or to a rule or regulation shall be deemed to include any successor law, rule or regulation of similar effect or applicability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
